title: Works as advertised

I love that it alerts me while I'm away if temp inside goes to high, I have animals inside that need to stay cool! It's been great for monitoring what happens when I am away. Didn't know my cat ate every 15 minutes all night long or that my dog was so uncomfortable he moved every 30 minutes on his bed, or that neighbors come in and steal food! Seriously, this is hands down fantastic! Only time I have trouble viewing video is if I get notification and my partner opens video at same time. Ignore the naysayers and try this out. I've had it for maybe 6 months now and am very happy. No need to upgrade to >12 hour as you can download a video if needed to keep. Also, use the sensitivity settings and tagging feature-it seems to learn from you! It used to notify me every time the wind blew but now it records but doesn't notify unless its a human or major activity. I've also noticed it recognizes I am home faster when I have wifi on my phone. iPhone 6s and iPad pro both running iOS 10

title: Okay, not horrible
text:
Update:   Still using our Canaries with no subscription; your mileage may vary but ours work just fine.   I like the way it now puts a little square around where the motion is so I know it’s just the heater moving the curtains, or just the wind blowing the trees outside.   When we have renters at our cabin it’s easy to take the indoor camera out while they’re there, put it back in when gone.   We have Ring cameras on the outside that are permanently installed, no easy way to disconnect temporarily.  Will continue to use our Canaries because for us they do exactly what is needed.  

Previous post:

We have had our canaries for almost two years I think?   Yes, we were extremely unhappy when they pulled the rug from under us and took away free features we used to have.  They know it was a huge mistake...fortunately I now see 30 seconds of video when motion is triggered, for 24 hours, which is better than what I had before (it was 12 hours per device previously).   This is free, no monthly charge.  I don’t understand the reviews that say they are not recording videos when motion is triggered because mine do.  Complain all you want but you won’t find a better deal with any other security camera.  I’ll keep using my canaries (for live views and motion triggered notifications and videos) until this free service goes away.   Then I’ll look into something like Nest, but hoping it won’t come to that.

title: Terrible customer support
text:
Everything was working fine until I got a notice on my IPad that I needed to update the Canary app with the latest version.  When I attempted to load the latest version I thengot a notice that Canary's latest version was not compatible with my model of IPad and did I want to download the latest "compatible" version of the app.  I said yes and the app downloaded. But when I opened it it again said I needed to load the latest version.  I am now in a continuous never ending loop where I download the latest compatible version only to be told to again load the latest version of the app.  When I finally got through to their customer service I was told my IPad could no longer be used since it made my Canary insecure in that someone could hack into it and view what is on the camera.  I told customer service I didn't care who saw the image since I only use the camera when I go on vacation and all it views is my front door.  I ask the customer service person how can I download the previous compatible version albeit "non-secure" version of the app so I can again use my bought and paid for Canary.  I was told there was no way for me to do that and instead I had to buy a new IPad.   Could you believe this?  Stay away from Canary.
Why can't you make the old version of the app that worked on my IPad available to me and others that do not want to buy a ~$400 new IPad to work with a ~$100 camera?

title: eh, it’s okay
text:
5ghz wifi kept giving me password issues as one reviewer had. Device hardware only supports 2.4, so I switched and that seemed to work. I already had the app crash when I had a single notification waiting for me to view from the home screen. I also can’t send, link, or do much of anything with the videos it takes. I can do a manual screen shot but that’s no fun. Would like to see a way to save the videos or share directly from the app into a message, email, etc. 

When selecting arming modes or much of anything from the application’s home screen, it seems to take a bit of screwing around to get back to the home screen of the app. The video has looked good over wifi and LTE. I’m not quite sure what the posts within an app are suppose to do, and when identifying movement of a video, I used other to put in a new category, it would be nice to see this new category continued as an on-going option as I keep getting the same thing again and again. Looking forward to the next update and I think there is a lot of potential. Lastly, with the geofence, I am worried about the battery life on my phone 6. The battery life on all iPhones is completely garbage already, a geofence will just kill it faster. It would be nice to change the ping frequency of the geofence using from always on to 10 minutes in a variable slider.

title: App broken with iOS 13 update
text:
The app crashes constantly after updating to iOS 13.  I contacted customer support who indicated to uninstall the app reboot the phone, etc.  I kept telling them that I had already done that and Canary customer support kept denying that there was a problem with the app.  Then after escalating the issue the only response I got is that the app would be fixed in a week.  A week has past and gone and no updates.  Recently, I contacted them again and I got the same run around about there being nothing wrong with the app and ios13.  If you notice, the last update to the app was 2 months ago.  They have obviously not done anything to get it up to speed with iOS 13 like other developers which had their updates out before or quickly after update.  I had high hopes for these cameras but now it’s broken and I’m canceling my subscription to the service since it obviously doesn’t work.  Company seems to be unsympathetic to customers needs and only offers basic steps to resolve problems and denies that there is a problem and tries to blame it on customer error.  Bad customer service all the way around.  If you have ios13 and have picked up one of these cameras, RETURN IT until the company straightens up the app issue because the camera is almost useless without the APP!

Update:  Still not working after update for iOS 13!  It doesn’t crash when I go to live view but all I see is a green screen!

title: Latest update is awful
text: I usually don’t write reviews but this last update is really frustrating me.  Been using the app for over a year, it’s usually been good but this last update (July 2019) has made my cameras almost worthless as I can’t control them half the time anymore.  It’s so buggy now like if I’m home for example and try to switch to night mode so I have them on when I go to bed, it just flickers the mode status icon and stays in home mode.  LUCKILY the time schedule seems to still work so I use that to switch it right now but obviously you should be able to switch modes manually if you want like you used to.  Also, over half the time now if I come home, it doesn’t switch to home mode anymore.  If I open the app THEN quit and reopen it, it finally sees I’m home and shuts off the cameras.  Didn’t used to have to do any of this til this last update.  The app seems to be crashing more often now too when it first opens.  I’ve uninstalled it, signed out and in, even tried it on my separate work iPhone (which didn’t have it before), same exact issues. I pay for the subscription but if the app doesn’t work half the time I may not renew when it ends this month.  It worked so well for me in the past, not perfect of course (what is) but really I was liking how everything functioned.  But this update now has me possibly looking at other brands as I was needing another one.  Please fix or pull this update!

title: Was great, until...
text:
We have had a Canary in our house for a year now. My wife and I love it. It is been a great source of security for us both when away and home. While away, it would record any movement or sound and send me a text message whether I was at work, the store, or across the world. It’s also a great monitor if I want to keep an eye on my kid from another room, being able to see and hear what he’s doing, playing or watching. We would also occasionally use it for making funny videos, having conversations remotely, and even “checking the tape” to confirm what someone had said earlier in the day. The camera quality is great, with a perfect field of view for our needs. It’s an attractive piece of hardware. Sure the app left a lot to be desired, but it was serviceable and I had no complaints.

Until today, that is. I decided to do some research as to why I was not getting text messages lately from the camera. The live view seems to work fine, but my history was empty. I come to find out that I now need to pay for virtually all of the services that I was using from this device. Services, I might add, that were all promised to be included free when we bought the device. Which is why we bought the device. How is this OK?

We were actually about to buy two more of these cameras, and buy into the Canary ecosystem. Not anymore. I caution everyone on this purchase.

title: Great video quality but needs some improvements
text: Great video quality but needs some improvements. Two off the top. One there needs to be a mute button. I have to put my Bluetooth headphones on so that I don’t disturb the people that are around me and for my own privacy. I have other security cameras and they have the ability to mute. I see no reason why a high quality security camera system shouldn’t at least have mute. And Two as with my other security cameras and they give the option of all at once select and delete. This may require a redesign but would be very beneficial in using these cameras. If you already know that there’s nothing to be concerned over we shouldn’t have to go through every alert and clear them one by one. My dog sets them off. Do I need to watch my dog stretching? And that’s with PEOPLE selected. I feel these things should be addressed to make using these in a more effect way. I don’t like having to pay either. I don’t pay for any other system and I use three including Canary. I read that also has been addressed by other reviewers. Perhaps if Canary wants people to buy and recommend them they should listen to people like me that have had them for a long time now and want them to succeed and be as great as they can be. ThankYou.

title: IOS 10 Update Did Something!
text: Here I am in New York City, trying to monitor my home in the Kansas City Area. It shows activity and a frame of the room. I click on it to see the video and get either a grey box with an endless spinning wheel, or a pop up message that says, "Video not available, please try again later." I have tried hard reset of my phone...nothing. Then, since I'm on the free plan, the video disappears after 12 hours, without me being able to see the recorded video! What's the point? I have two cameras and both have this issue at the same time. Yesterday morning, it worked fine. Problems started in the afternoon. I have an alarm system and a friend popped in to check on things. All was fine. Both Canary cameras did not even record him entering and then moving about the apartment! There was not even an activity alert! No, my sensitivity settings are not too low. He has a Canary at HIS home and it somehow triggered on MY Canary to go into HOME mode when it sensed him enter, and AWAY mode when he left! No, he is not listed as a member on my account! What the heck is wrong with Geo-fencing??? What the heck is wrong with playing back recorded video of movements? I don't even get notified for many of the alerts! But what's the use of notifying me when I can't watch reliably watch the alleged recorded video? I'm not happy as I paid a lot for two cameras! (Live video is fine!)

title: NOT a pet monitor
text: This is a fine system for human monitoring, but when I saw they're now advertising this as a pet monitoring system, I had to write a review. We've been using a Canary for over 2 years now. When we first got it, we could see our cat everytime she entered the room. After abot a year we began to see her less and less on recorded videos. I contacted Canary about this, to which they replied that they've changed the software to ignore certain repetative motion such as pets (even though they're advertising it as a pet monitor!!!!???) and that I should set the sensitivity higher to see more videos. The sensitivity is as high as it can be and we still do not see about half of the videos of our cat in the living room as when she actually is. We know this because we are away often for work and check on her often and see her walking around, yet no videos are posted. Canary specifically told us they were actively reducing the frequency of pet videos and now they’re advertising it as a pet monitoring system. I really think this is wrong. We also have some connection issues over wifi with the units being within 10 feet of open air in our livingroom to an expensive, well built wifi router. To top all of that off, their plans for service used to be the cheapest, and now aren't even competitive. I'd advise looking elsewhere, specifically for pet monitoring.

title: Stop Expecting Everything to be Free
text: Seriously, how to you expect this company to support all of the app features, cloud recording, the servers needed to keep this app reliable, the customer support, the instant emergency calling, the two-way audio support.... I mean, come on this thing is PACKED full of features that used to cost people $50 - $200 a month when big security companies were coming in to set it up and monitor it. Now you can do it yourself and have full control of your home security with tons of convenient features added in. It's $10 a month for a single camera if you want access to all the features, but you don't have to have all the features - you can elect to only receive live monitoring and emergency calls / siren activation - pretty good for a free service. So stop expecting everything to be free. These companies exist to make money, and they can't turn a profit if they give you all these features at no charge. They aren't a charity, they're a growing business.

text: They have reneged on the deal that they promised when I bought the unit. And I was stupid enough to buy two! Now their marketing is attempting to tell the consumer that the canary membership offer is better for the consumer. It isn't. Now you must pay for options that canary advertised as free services, which was the main reason I bought the unit when I did. And to add insult to injury the phone number that one of the canary reps gave me to speak with a representative is now all automated. Infuriating! They don't care about their customers. What I have remaining is expensive garbage. Thanks canary.

title: DO NOT USE
text: Worst security System that I have ever encountered. The idea is great but this company is the worst tech company & customer Service business I have ever dealt with. Yes the device looks good and yes the app seems like it would be exactly what you need but it is HORRIBLE. title: Reality Check - Disappointment Abounds
text: Objectively speaking the accompanying app, the new “service” plans, the server blackouts, and the poor customer service continue to drive the quality of the actual hardware device straight down to useless for the average user.  Specifics:  received as a present (thank goodness!) in May 2015; have experienced at least 4 server blackouts of at least 24 hours with no acknowledgement on their website; wrote customer service regarding the multitude of steps to delete recordings and suggested a quick delete feature like in my Manythings app and received a “thanks for your comments”; their free service has disintegrated into only being able to use it within 4 hours of a recording which is unacceptable since most people use for travel/vacation and aren’t going to check their app and go to the website to download every few hours; which brings me to … i have gone to the website to download recordings … never happens.  If you want to charge for a service you might want to provide the service effectively and consistently before you ramp up the costs and cut back on the service.  As it stands … my free Manythings app is providing constant, reliable service on an old iPhone 4S that I’m recycling.  Most users expect a heck of a lot more for a $250 device.  Time to either wake up or shut down!

title: UI STILL needs a major overhaul
text:
This app is a nightmare to navigate, and is inconsistent with modern mobile standards. It is impossible to download a video go your iOS photos app too - you have to either email it to yourself or save it to the local file system. How can this be acceptable, especially for something we have to pay a monthly fee to use?

What other UI employs a “bounce” effect for video? It makes no sense, and causes accidental exiting of the screen. Because video streams from the cloud each time it is opened, you have to buffer all over again and you lose your place. Because of this streaming situation, you have to “request” a download from the cloud which results in an extremely small video file with high levels of compression, and it doesn’t even save to your photos! So you have to text or email it to yourself just to watch the clip again offline... bizarre, right?

The hardware is excellent but the UI/UX is a nightmare. Please fix, it would take very little time to turn this around! Your potential customers’ first impressions are critical, and this app is likely to blame for loss of paid subscriptions. Four years later and no improvement... where is my money going?

title: Good concept, actual function needs improvement
text:
As a whole, this app would be great if it worked the way they wanted it to. The camera is constantly disconnecting and reconnecting even thought the WiFi connection is fine. It often won’t register that we’re home and will alert us over and over again that “there’s a person at home” even though we’re there. Going into the app and adjusting the settings does nothing to help this.  The app glitches often, and usually runs very slowly. When watching a video it recorded, there will often times be gaps in the video feed. Example: we use this to watch our pets when we’re not home and they’ll often set off the camera to start recording. But they’ll be walking across the living room, then the video will glitch and our pet will magically appear on the other side of the room. The two-way talk is only available if you purchase a premium membership (but to be honest, with the quality of the camera it’s really not worth it). The two-way talk is also very glitchy and sometimes comes across garbled and hard to understand. 
Overall, it’s not entirely bad. It just needs a lot of improvement.

title: So much potential, but a buggy app and lame support
text:
I’ve been trying to like our Canary for years now. Never-ending geolocation issues, buggy logging and a support team that simple repeats their script without ever actually investigating the problem. As of today: CS: “You need to log out of your app, close and delete the app, then refresh the app to 5.5.1” as our records show you have 5.5.0”. Me: “I’ve deleted and re-downloaded my app several times over the last week. App Store shows 5.5.0”. CS: “You need to log out of your app, close and delete the app, then refresh (their words) the app to 5.5.1” as our records show you have 5.5.0”. Me: “You clearly aren’t listening to me. The App Store shows the version on the store as 5.5.0, updated a month ago. How am I supposed to get 5.5.1.” CS: “You need to log out of your app, close and delete the app, then refresh (their words) the app to 5.5.1” as our records show you have 5.5.0”. And so on ad nauseam.  I think it’s time to switch to Arlo.

Update 08/27: the developer informed that 5.5.1 is not, in fact, available for iPhone. After CS wasted so much of my time. I tried to cancel my Canary Premium account, which after several screens directed me to call them.

They just keep digging the hole deeper.

title: Unreliable
text: Notifications go off for every tiny shadow movement, flicker of light, or my cat rolling over (what’s the point of tagging animals?). Notifications are slow and recording starts way after movement is detected. My husband didn’t tell me that he let the maintenance in, so I get a notification of 2 men leaving my apartment about 10 minutes after they’d already left. Just leaving, like literally walking out the door. I have no idea how long they were in my apartment or where they walked around (we live in a studio and can see the whole apartment with the camera). What’s the point if recording starts at the end? What if they broke into my apartment? I wouldn’t have any images of their faces. App constantly says we’re not home and starts to record when we are home, or doesn’t switch to away mode when we’re not home. Camera is always disconnecting and reconnecting, even though we have very good internet. We were thinking of getting the outdoor camera after some stuff on our porch was recently stolen, but we’ve made the decision to switch to Ring. We’ve stuck with Canary since we’ve moved here 4 years ago, but there’s just been too many problems and I’m tired of it. I need a security system I can rely on.

title: Outdoor Camera
text:
The app and interface work fine. The indoor cameras are decent, picture quality could be better and other systems have a few more options than these do but I haven’t noticed a serious  need for them. 
The outside camera is junk. I haven’t had this thing a year yet and it’s already quirky.  The battery doesn’t hold a charge, it won’t recharge. It pops on and off signal all the time. I have a wifi booster 20 feet away from the camera in a window and I’ve moved it as close as I possibly can but it still pops on and off WiFi. The outdoor camera does not have night mode like the inside cameras do. So what’s the point? No one trapes around outside of your house in broad daylight.  The sensor on it is iffy. I have it set to the most sensitive and you still have to be 10 feet away for it to trigger.  So it’s not very reliable unless you have the video up on your phone constantly and then all you are doing is draining that battery that is junk. 
Let me know when you put more into the outdoor camera and make it better.  Otherwise I’ll figure out how to set up and indoor camera facing outside, so it can have window glare.

title: Too good to be free
text: I’ve had my canary for over a year and they recently “improved” the watch live feature.  So now instead of being able to watch my live feed when I’m not home to make sure nobody is in my room, I have to pay a membership fee to have access to the feature that was originally a primary purpose for purchasing one; watch live.  So now the only way my canary can be functional is when every person who can check in on the canary is not home.  Which  also makes my outside canary less functional; if I hear a noise outside at night my canary is no longer an option with its night vision because I’ll have to pay a membership fee to feel secure with the recently handicapped home security “smart” device.  So if you want to spend $200 on a home security device don’t buy this one because not only will you have to make sure you have a decent internet connection, which is expected, but you’ll now have to pay canary a membership fee to have access to basic features that were originally included.  So go buy a nest, or an alro or anything else but this scam.  I’m stuck with this poor investment and I’ll probably email them hate mail and then go to a buffet and emotionally eat while I research alternatives.

title: Canary removed features AFTER PURCHASE
text: I bought my canary about 2 years ago at which time without a membership you were allowed access to videos for 24h. If you wanted videos stored longer you needed to upgrade to a membership. This was my understanding & it is what made me chose Canary. Now they change the terms so that you get these mini clips that cutoff WHILE motion is happening unless you pay the fee. If they chose to do this for new users that is fine. Ppl can buy or not based on this understanding. But to impose this on long time users feels like a racket. I’m sure they are legally within their rights to do this but I now need to either pay for a membership or toss my canary and buy a different brand of camera that will do what my canary was once capable of. I refuse to give canary another dollar. I have recommended this camera to several friends & was about to purchase a flex. I’m glad i didn’t now. I’m thoroughly disappointed & as a business practice this should not be allowed. Imagine if you bought a dryer & after 2 years the manufacturer came by & modified it so it would only run 30 minutes at a time. Then asked you for more money to make it run for a full cycle like it used to. Fair? Doesn’t feel like it.

title: Better and better
text:
Canary is a great product that's been a lot of fun to experiment with and get to know.  My husband bought the product early on so we've had it for sometime now.  We've learned how to use it just how we need it and we really enjoy being able to check in our puppy throughout the day and know what's happening at home (when the dog walker visits or the landlord enters our apartment).  The best part about Canary has been the fast and really good updates to the app.  Every few weeks the app gets more polished and adds a few new features.  My husband and I love being surprised by the possibilities and learning what we can do.  Canary seems to know exactly what I want from the app and makes those updates first... mode information, emergency actions, and more!

I really recommend Canary for anyone who likes to be worry free or just wants to be better connected to their home.

title: Great Product became totally unreliable
text: I loved this product when I first got it, it runs very differently now.  Not smooth even with a strong WiFi connection (I work in Rockefeller Plaza and have a wired connection at home, there should be no cannot connect you at this time message).  Very slow to load, The red banner appears often, and they’ve constantly taken away features I took for granted to include in a membership.  The membership does not improve the signal glitches.  If you get this product now you will have to expect random connectivity issues every time you try to access your canary device.  I bought this for security and do not feel secure.  In fact, I bought this at first mainly to protect against home invasion but without subscription, recording is turned off when I am home.  A robber can come into my apartment and beat me and my puppy to death, take everything, and Canary will not record a second of it anymore.  I feel like I’m stuck with Canary until I can afford a new camera but if you are a prospective buyer looking for a reliable camera for peace of mind, go with Logitech and spare yourself of this company that had a great product and ruined it with their greed.

title: Wish I went with another service
text: While I was excited about the Canary setup at first, the day to day operations have led me to be anything but. The cameras themselves work decent enough; although the indoor models have a bright LED light ring under the device that can’t be turned off, so if you are going for stealth that isn’t an option. They have made the available feature to dim them, but it only does about 30%. The outdoor model has been tethered to my account for 4 days now, however it has been updating for two days and it still won’t connect with the server. When it was actually connected the battery that is advertised as lasting for months lasted only 2 days.  I have contacted CS multiple times and unfortunately they don’t have a phone number so you are at the mercy of a 48 hour email response. The app itself is buggy as hell, I usually have to force close the app just to get what I need to do accomplished. I wish I went with a Nest system at this point, but I am already invested in this setup. They have no functionality with Google Home, another downside. I’d try something else if I were you. Or, you can buy mine! 😉

title: Good in the beginning, nothing but garbage now.
text:
Bought a Canary All-in-One device in November of ‘16. It notified me of any movement. Cats, shift in light, various company. This was perfect for me. I was able to make the blind spot where the ceiling fans were so it wasn’t constantly recording. Here it is October of ‘17 and Canary decide to update their software. I no longer receive any form of notification unless I am physically walking into my own house. Videos are no longer videos but partial clips before the actual motion starts. For instance, I come home today to find broken glass on my floor. Previously, I was notified of movement and sounds. Not today. Checked the videos and nothing. A few clips in which a cat moved but nothing after. Another showing a dark room then a light turning on in the hallway and end of video. They made “Full videos” a feature with the membership, recording when home a membership feature, and various other changes that have made this device useless to me.

This device was perfect for me, however their greed must have taken over because it’s useless without a membership now. I will be returning this and researching for something else.

title: Canary is a nightmare since they added an app
text:
Canary used to be good before they added a paid premium and added an app that needs to constantly be updated. I enjoy an older version of iphone and don’t require or WANT to update my phone to the latest ioS because it uses too much GB and slows my phone down which basically means I can no longer use a Canary I paid more than $200. For . 

Also I originally picked this because it was  allegedly falsely advertised on the box  as to having a 2 way voice speaking system. After setting up and it not working, the company said it was coming soon. Then it came after a long while , but wasn’t available unless you paid for monthly subscription , so it should never have been advertised on boxes till it existed and then it should have said with monthly subscriptions only . Doesn’t deserve any stars . Should be able to be used like the Nest cameras without subscribing and with a 2 way speakers system as advertised on box . I would never had bought this if Canary was honest on the box and did not advertise a 2 way speaker when they hadn’t even created it yet .

title: Good for ad-hoc activity when you’re available. Useless for activity checking after the fact.
text:
Like I said in the title, it’s completely useless to record actual activity in your home when there is a person and you can’t watch it live. Obviously people are not always in front of the camera. But if my camera notices a person and even notifies me of one why wouldn’t it continue recording after the movement? For like two minutes at least? And a minute leading up to it? There’s stuff happening outside the frame!?

Sometimes it switches modes when arriving home, most times it doesn't. So I always have to open the app when leaving and arriving at home. I usually don't have my hands free at these points in my day (nor is it why I bought the system in the first place).
Customer service told me to increase the geofence radius. Didn’t help.
I got home 10 minutes ago, am connected to WiFi, stood in front of the camera a while, went to have a wee, and just got another notification of a person at home when I reentered the kitchen...

title: Worst customer service
text: My canary is a worthless paperweight. They offered many other features when I first bought and then poof they became paid features shortly after I bought at the much higher price point. Now the geofence will not work correctly on my husbands phone. It’s doesn’t correctly identify when he comes and goes. He can be sitting in the house, phone not moving and it will say he left, then he returned several times without touching his phone. Now it won’t even identify him leaving at all, as if he’s home all the time. So when we are both gone the system never activates away mode correctly to secure my home to take video if necessary. I have contacted customer support several times but the only means of support is email, no phone support. Very inconvenient because by the time they reply days later it never fixes the problem with the solutions they try to give you. I have tried removing my husbands app and reinstalling, also removing as a user and reinviting, I have also tried correcting geofence which by the way never changed and settings in the first place. So frustrated.

title: Unreliable
text:
I bought several of these and they work great at first then after first week devices started randomly going offline for no reason and ok , no big deal because i was still receiving notifications that device went offline. Now a month later the devices are going offline and either sending notifications up to 30 min later or currently now not  sending me notifications on my phone in app AT ALL.    Im very unhappy and if i could return them i would. Im going to look into that 2morrow.
  What a disappointment. Oh ya and besides that issue they also go offline and when they were sending notifications it would send device back online notification b4 the offline one . Lol.
