title: Poor execution
text: Canary as a concept is great. The price is good. What’s terrible is the way this company has designed the app. It’s extremely slow to connect, and sometimes it doesn’t until you force close the app and try again. By comparison, our Arlo connects quickly and so does the Ring doorbell. I’ve let support know in the past. However, it was blamed on WiFi slowness. I have gigabit Internet through Cox, so I know that can’t be it. And Arlo and Ring both have no issues. Clearly the issue with with THIS system. I’m sure someone will reply to this to have me contact support so they can point out the inadequacy of my gigabit Internet instead of acknowledge that Canary is the problem. Also, they have an awesome geo fencing feature that puts the unit into away mode if everyone is gone. But ... everyone connected to the app has full access to change settings, view all videos, delete videos, and even remove the device. There is no concept of an administrator. This ... in modern day is not very good. These guys are behind the curb in every way imaginable. They excel at absolutely nothing.

title: Canary usually works, customer support slightly slower
text:
RANDOMLY SAYS YOU’RE HOME WHEN YOU’RE NOT.
We bought a few years ago. We overcame its tendency to alarm at shadows (literally), which I’m okay with. What I’m not as excited about is when it tells me one of us is home (so it won’t alert) when all of the phones synced to it are out of the house- WAY out of the house. This has happened before. The current error has now been going on for over a week with no resolution from Canary. Good luck if you buy- it’s a roll of the dice. UPDATE: After first reaching out 15 days ago, explaining that the device shows that my son’s phone is here at home when it is, in fact, two states away, I still have no resolution. Understand that this means the device would not tell me when a stranger breaks in because it ALWAYS thinks my son is here at home, even when, in fact, no one is home. Were I to buy again I think I would go elsewhere. ANOTHER UPDATE: For no apparent reason, Canary has decided ANOTHER user that leaves the house will show up is at home, leaving the house unprotected. It’s like playing roulette.

title: Rip off
text:
Update: I don’t know how it could’ve gotten worse but it did. It took a very long time to set all the preferences to get  it used to my dog, to get it used me, to get it use to my lights going on and off on a timer, and for some reason all of that is gone, I am getting constant notifications that someone is in my home, it’s causing way too much anxiety. it’s just not working at all it’s a complete waste of money. 

I have been using Canary for a few years now. It’s extremely unfair and a rip off that I purchased this at full price and now I need to pay membership on top of it in order for it to do it’s job! This is a terrible Way to treat a loyal customer. There’s a lot less expensive device is out there on the market, for that sake I can just use my laptop, it would be more reliable. All canary is for me right now is a drain on my Wi-Fi and a paperweight.

Canary listen to your customers, the customers who got you Going in the first place. Allow us to use the device without a membership! you’re putting people at risk, you’re putting their belongings at risk, you’re putting their pets and children at risk.

title: I used to love this....
text:
I used to love our Canary but with the most recent updates it has me considering selling them and going with another alternative. 

Ever since a couple updates ago, great features have been taken away and it makes no sense as to why. We have two cameras (one in our bedroom and one in the main area). We used to be able to switch modes for each camera independently but now if you change one, it changes both. I’ve tried everything to prevent this to no avail. 

Second - here I am, in bed at 10:30 pm and my canaries haven’t switched to on for night mode. I wonder why - I thought. I go to the app to check and low and behold I no longer have access to a feature that I’ve been able to use for nearly 2 years. WHY DID YOU MAKE NIGHT MODE A MEMBERSHIP ONLY FEATURE?!?!? This is the DUMBEST change ever. There is 0 reason to be why I should need to upgrade to a membership for a feature I have ALWAYS had access to until the most recent update. I refuse to upgrade. I have no need for the membership features right now but let me tell you - this change is making me rethink what devices I want to use.

title: Price Hike while removing features
text: While I’ve had my Canary for over a year I’ve been satisfied with it. We used it to watch our house while we’re away and keep an eye on our kids when they get home from school to make sure they’re doing homework or burning it down. The MAJOR problem I’ve had lately is the rate hikes and slowly taking features away from the free plan. Initially when I bought the Canary you could see full length recordings but only for things that took place within the last 24 hours.  If you wanted more, it was $9.99 to see the last 30 days worth of video. Now they’ve added new features to the paid membership, like innercom and website videoing, the free plan remained unchanged. That was until just recently where now you only get 10-second video previews of what was recorded.  I’m selling this garbage and finding something else. I paid I think $200 for this thing and now I feel like I’m being given a bait and switch to make me sign up for the membership and not even given notice of the change or grandfathered in.  Goodbye Canary, you won’t be getting anymore of my money.

title: App Needs Real Work
text:
The hardware is good, customer support is good, and the idea is great--but the poorly written app nullifies much of the value. The automatic location awareness almost never works. If you do not manually activate/deactivate the unit when you leave home/return, you go entire days unprotected or suffer numerous nuisance "alerts" that you are home and walking around. Apple's location services easily and reliably support the intended use here, but the app is just badly written and doesn't do this most important thing correctly. With this handicap, Canary is more an unreliable concept toy than a serious security device. 

UPDATE: With the latest release, Canary is trying to re-monetize paid customers by forcing them onto paid plans. This contradicts their marketed freemium value proposition, which WAS true until now. The release still doesn't fix the issue in which Canary fails properly to auto-sense whether you are home and to arm/disarm itself accordingly. 

I am still in the money-back guarantee period and considering returning the unit and buying a competitor product.

title: Slow and poor support for landscape
text:
I work at home with my iPad on my desk; sometimes I want to check activity outside (i.e., kids, package). Here are my observations:

The time from opening the app to getting to seeing a clear video is roughly 7 seconds on a good day which is most of the time but sometimes the feed won’t load for a good 20 - 30 seconds which is really annoying because at that point it makes you wonder why you spend so much money on the cameras; sometimes the feed will never load.

The app has this annoying feature where if you have a table or phone in landscape mode, the app forces portrait but then when the video loads, it can be in landscape... but if you want to change your volume or brightness for example by using the Control Center via swipe, the app forces portrait mode again... only to go back to landscape when the video is back on... SUPER ANNOYING!!!!!

The cameras are very high quality. It can get to 0 degrees where i live on a cold winter day and the cameras have no issues being outside. 

Overall I’m happy with the product apart from the aforementioned items but I think I would seriously research alternatives if I had to re-do the cameras around my house. I’ve even thought about buying a couple more but feel that it would be a waste of money given the performance of the iOS App. I hope they fix this, it’s been like this since 2016. :(

title: OMG this thing is unbelievable!
text: Ok, I just set it up today, and I'm not an expert in home video systems or anything. But. So far my mind is blown. I've worked in retail and the camera quality is much, MUCH higher than anything I've seen in retail. It has night vision that turns on in the dark! I didn't think it was possible to see that well in the dark unless you were in the army or Mission Impossible. It sees much better in the dark than the human eye.  The mic really picks up a lot. And it really did take about 5 minutes of super-easy setup. (2 mins were just waiting for it to do its thing).  I worked from home today so I was home all day and it noticed me every time I moved in its area. I don't know about service and outages and so on but so far the equipment itself (including the app) is really impressive. I want to test the alarm but I haven't yet because I'm afraid I'll scare the neighbors!

title: From great to lousy
text: Our dogs are diabetic, so when they were diagnosed a year and a half ago, we bought a canary. Initially, it was great. The recording was easy to access, the notifications were simple to customize, there were desirable features on the horizon. And then, the updates started. With every update, the app got worse. I contacted support, to be told that my WiFi strength was the cause of the issue, despite the fact that we were hard wired. Then all of the desirable features turned into paid membership-only features (that was conveniently omitted when these were announced). The final straw was the god-awful person detection. I was getting random notifications as it was, but they increased 50-fold to send erroneous notifications that a person was in my home all day long. From glares to dogs to curtains, they’re all culprits. We have since switched to iSmartAlarm and are much happier with the outcome. The iSmartAlarm app is reliable, the notifications are easy, and the compatible door/window sensors and alarm keypad make it an all inclusive security system, for the same price as one defunct canary.

title: Needs improvement
text:
This is my first App Store review ever.
I just got a puppy and I use my canary camera to monitor the dog but the screen literally freezes every few minutes and I have to restart the app. I’m using iPhone 11 Pro and the latest OS.  No issues with other apps.  Also I have 7 canary cameras and you cannot set the order of the cameras in the list.  The dog is in the room with camera 6.  So each time I have to swipe 6 times to get to the right camera.  Need to Repeat this multiple times a day since the app freezes.  Very frustrating might change them all to Nest cam soon if this doesn’t get fixed

Update - since I wrote the review, the live stream for the camera in my dogs room stopped working entirely.  It just spins and never loads the live stream.  Other cameras are working fine and it works for my husbands iPhone.  Developer responded to re install the app (5.2.1) which I did and live steam still doesn’t work For that camera only.  I can only watch timeline videos

title: Buggy software, and bad business practices
text:
The Canary hardware is actually pretty good. Everything else is terrible though. This is easily the buggiest app on my iPhone (out of dozens). I've gotten used to force closing it like it was a regular operation. Not reliable at all.

On top of that - expect the company to completely change your feature lineup and service plan terms every couple of years. They just did it again in April 2021. Their business model must be crap if they need to keep raising prices and putting features behind a paywall. Imagine if someone like Verizon just arbitrarily decides to raise the price on your existing plan, instead of only applying rate changes to new users and grandfathering in the rest? Yea - not good. Just because you can legally change the service terms of current users doesn't mean you should Canary. It makes me think the company is in financial trouble the way these price hikes keep coming out.

Run far away from this app and Canary. Get yourself a Google Nest, pay a few bucks a month more, and spare yourself some headaches.

title: Strong start, kinks to work out
text:
The hardware is great. Picture clear, and night mode sees better than any other webcams I've used.  That said, they've still got work to do on the software side.  

The learning seems to be coming up short so far as well. I keep telling it that it's seeing ceiling fans but it keeps continually triggering on them. The ability to just mask them out would help. 

I look forward to seeing the service improve.

Edit (2/15 bumped from 3 to 4 stars since I fixed my one big issue: I fixed the lack of live view and setting privacy mode. Not sure which was the ultimate fix but I signed out of the app on my iPhone and iPad, then only signed in via iPhone.  Since one of my 2 cams still didn’t revert to privacy I unplugged and replugged to reboot it and after that they started responding and allowing live views again.

Features that would be cool:
- Ability to access and download videos via web (supposedly working on this according to their FAQ)
- Ability to have geofencing switch to privacy when arriving home vs just disarmed mode
- Schedule times to switch into disarmed/armed modes (to allow programming in to/out of recording vs privacy at night).
- Ability to mask out spots early on due to fans/TVs, though the learning bits seem to be slowly getting there.

title: Bumpy start but smooth finish for Canary ...
text: What the box promises and what is actually required to use the device couldn’t be more opposite. This requires a membership to use.  I don’t understand why the developers of this camera doesn’t just come out and market the requirements to use this product instead of being sorta deceptive about it. The app was extremely buggy and ambiguous at first set up with my iPhone X. Even with membership I had only gotten the “watch live” feature to work once in a 48 hr period after setting up... but by the forth day the bugs in the software seem to have been fixed and now the camera and service has worked without exception- ever since! So once you get through the difficult set up period the Device does what is promoted - but only with the undisclosed ‘membership’ added! For that reason I’m giving this App and device a three star rating. Change the marketing and I’ll change the rating to a 5 Star!

title: The App, while not perfect, is not terrible...
text:
A lot of these reviews are referencing issues that have nothing to do with the  function of the App. Actual issues (reasons this app didn't get 5 stars): uses location services constantly and runs my battery down, forces me to connect to wifi to download my saved clips no matter the size, I have to go to the website to change/signup for a plan, and it sometimes gives me Alerts before it has finished compiling the actual motion meaning it pauses for a second to complete the video. 

I changed it to two stars because now I can't download videos, I get alerts even though other members are home because it arms itself when I leave and it frequently says it can't connect. 

Otherwise the App is fine. Issues with the device or your opinion of prices shouldn't be used when rating the app. I had no problem setting it up, I do agree that the plans are a bit pricey and I wish the the bottom wasn't lit up when connected but the app functions.

title: Still working flawlessly for me!
text:
Recent free updates improve the user interface. The addition of the masking feature is a nice improvement to eliminate some unwanted notifications. My 2 Canary's still work flawlessly. 
I monitor 2 homes with Canarys. They both work essentially perfectly on my iPhone iOS 10 for this purpose. I have had them since they came on the market. 6 hour storage of video is all I need so I pay no fee. There have been continual no charge upgrades along the way all of which I have found of value.  One great upgrade was low temperature monitoring and notification which of course is of great value to a second home owner in winter.  Any questions I have had have been answered within hours with meaningful information. This is an excellent product for monitoring your second home and primary residence.

title: Needs 0 stars option
text:
BEWARE! Canary offers an email for support assistance but their response time is 1-3 business days and typically do not even respond during that timeframe. If you have problems with your cameras you WILL NOT get the problems fixed with their help. GO WITH ANOTHER OPTION. Have had no problems with different cameras I installed after the entire debacle of trying to get Canary cameras up and running - they did not work for even one day!

Cameras haven’t worked out of the box from canary (ordered through their website) and their only support option is a response via email in 1-3 business days. Their response on day 3 and not a second sooner was to ask for the serial number and asking me to power down and back up. I provided the requested info and am now waiting another 1-3 business days? Working on a week with no cameras since I spent the first few days prior to submitting a ticket trying to resolve myself. So much for a security camera! All I want at this point it to return these crap “cameras”.

title: Hateful
text:
Literally been trying for hours to set up my camera. For the amount of money I spent on it, and the additional cost of the “secure” mount, you’d think they’d have an app developed that actually works. My account is not set up as of writing this review because the app IS THAT BAD. It’s 2017. Seriously. A freshman in college could create an app for you that actually works. 

I tried setting up my account. Kept getting an error message about being “unable to connect to server”. Then I closed the app and tried to set up again. It then said my email was already in use. Suddenly I got NINE emails welcoming me to my new account.... but my password didn’t work. I’m currently stuck on entering my address. This error just says “Please try again later”. Excellent. 

If this isn’t set up by tomorrow at noon, I’ll be sending it all back for a refund. I can buy a 4 camera hard wired “night owl” system for less money than I paid for this single camera and mount. The app for “night owl” works excellent. I just thought it would be easier with a wireless system. Nope.

title: App and support are terrible
text: I've been unable to activate either of two Canaries since the release of IOS 9.  I've tried activation with an iPhone 6, an iPad Air, a 5th generation iPod touch (all running iOS 9) and the canary (either) reports that it can't hear the iOS device and then fails to activate.  Because I have two secure (yellow ) cables and two different wifi networks (one high speed cable, and a medium speed DSL) both powered by Apple Time Capsules (latest models) I've tried activating on both with the same fail.  After multiple contacts with Canary tech support they suggested trying activating by direct Ethernet connection to either or both routers.  When I reported the same results (no hear), canary tech support suddenly went silent.  I responded 8 days ago, as well as a resend yesterday, and they are refusing to respond further.  At this point I can't recommend either the hardware or the software.  They worked fine before IOS 9, but my experience suggests a total fail under IOS 9, and tech support no longer seems interested in trying to resolve the issue.

title: Went back to Canary
text: We’ve had Canary for years & when we moved to our new home, we decided to try a “simpler” security system to keep us “safe”. We were immediately disappointed that there were near to no options to use the system without having to pay for the monthly subscription & having to buy additional multiple products. Having just bought a new home, we are on a budget & just needed to know if anything was out of the ordinary while away. So, we returned the system, brought out our old Canary Pro & reinstalled the app. Happy to see a few improvements and appreciate the ability to still contact police & get notifications of motion while we are away without having to sign up to a monthly subscription.

title: Great app, if it was 15 years ago
text:
I’m actually not sure which is more frustrating, the app and it’s archaic functionality or the two canary cams I have. Actually the worst might be the “customer service”. 

To get any kind of help you have to submit a request through the app but then when you go back to the app there’s no record of your initial request. Sure, they’ll email you a couple days later. Then another person a few days after that. But that’s a dead end. No chat function. No ability to speak with anyone. Help forums are a waste. I’m still yet to communicate with anyone. 

My canary view cam got stuck in an update mode and has become absolutely useless. Need help...oh well. 

I’m not sure what I was thinking when I ordered a canary flex to replace my view. Wireless? Sure. For a few hours. THE BATTERY LIFE ON THE FLEX IS HORRIBLE. What’s worse? Well..did you know that when it’s plugged in there’s a large circle light that appears on the face of the camera?! Yes! Half of their selling points are based on the idea of stealth monitoring but then they design the thing to light up like a spotlight while plugged in. Of course you can use it a few hours without it plugged in but then a light flashes when it senses motion! I SAID A LIGHT FLASHES WHEN IT SENSES MOTION. 

What a huge disappointment, waste of money and time. Don’t try and save money with Canary. It’ll cost you more than you realize!

title: Disappointed Buyer Beware
text:
The Canary Flex hardware did not meet my expectations I am waiting for an email response from Lucy O the assigned support person. Live chat does not allow you to multi task.  (The chat window disappears when navigating to an issue)  live chat was not copied and sent to my email as a record when requested.  
Lucy O did not ask me my name, email address or account information.  So how did she get it?  I’m waiting for a response, and a response as to why my camera will not pick up motion detection when testing 3 ft in front of it. The software is not intuitive.  The Help Center website is not current.  Lucy said they no longer have home deductible reimbursement.  Why is it still on there?  The software app freezes when not in watch live mode.  To fix you must close the app then restart.   Support for a Canary device is limited to single task chat, email, or texting sms.  Real time resolution is provided via sms texting only.  No phone support. I hope the company improves.

title: Basic “Becky” system and app
text:
This service, both the hardware cams and the app, used to be pretty solid. No delays. No connectivity issues. No time lags. No outages.... but that was over 2 years ago. Today the app and website experience outages/service disruptions at least weekly, if not more frequently - so much for real time monitoring of your space. I have both Pro and Flex units all over the house that complemented each other. But now either the connectivity (drivers, hardware firmware - only compatible with 2.4Mhz wireless btw) or outdated antennas cause interference with each other or other standard home devices, resulting in blurred/grainy pictures or just outright “device offline” errors. 

At this point, since the capabilities and reliability of the hardware and software are just so unreliable and inconsistent, I am only just barely tolerating this service for the $700+ in device units and $500+ in monthly/annual service fees I’ve paid.

title: Was 5 Stars, now 1
text:
Problem 1: I pay for the 30 day video history subscription, although now an unknown bug only allows me to view the last 2 days, and my bookmarked videos disappear. I needed to download an important video and could view it on the web app, but not on the mobile app, which happens to be the only place where you can download the videos. After the same back and forth with customer service, there’s still no solution, and now 30 days has passed and the video I needed is gone forever.  

Problem 2: You use to be able to adjust the sensitivity level to record motion, but now you no longer can. About 80% of the movement of my cat never gets recorded. And the part I want recorded somehow seems to frequently glitch out with the audio or video. 

Conclusion: My only purpose of buying a canary and subscribing was to monitor my cat and be able to download videos from a 30 day history. But it fails miserably at everything it’s supposed to do. Not worth the purchase. You had one job, canary.

title: Canary Love
text: I love my Canary! Not only is it hilarious to finally watch my cat's shenanigans while I'm not at home, but I love being able to check out my apartment remotely when the building manager or utility person stops by while my husband and I are at work. I feel much more in control of my home's security. We live in SF with no central HVAC so it's also awesome to now track the temperature in our apartment. The product is small and sleek and I love how easily it connects to my iPhone. I'll admit I had a bit of a glitch setting the product up but realized it's because I just got the new iPhone 6s and there was some issue connecting. We used my husband's iPhone 5s instead and the setup worked just fine. I'm also a geek about design details so I especially loved the simplicity and design of the packaging and overall setup.

title: Love Canary despite occasional flaws
text: My canary devices work AMAZINGLY. I am having some issues getting way too many notifications on my outdoor one since the person detection came out last week, despite turning the sensitivity down to 0. This is a really big issue in my opinion but I do have faith canary will get it right soon enough and all will be well again. Customer service is fast and very helpful. People complain about the subscription but I don't see it being wrong in anyway. You can at least use the app just for surveillance without and most companies have a subscription as well. Not to mention this is how they pay for upgrading servers and continually improving the camera. What is offered with the subscription is beyond worth it, you get what you pay for as usual.

title: Bait and switch at its finest
text:
They are slowly but surely taking away features to force you to go to paid subscription. As it stand now my canary camera is useless as a security camera . Finally could not take it any more and tossed it in the garbage .
  You now only get a short clip of motion . Very short . On average I got about 6 seconds of nothing and 3 seconds of motion . Way to short to have any idea of what is going on . 
 It’s so bad my mail man drove into my drive way . He sat there a few seconds in the vehicle . So I ended up getting nothing more then a super short video of the vehicle pulling up . The motion of the driver getting out and walking up to my house to my mail box did not show up in the video . 
  They have gone way to far trying to force you to pay for a subscription to the point of making the camera worthless . 
  Not everyone can afford to pay out subscriptions . Rendering the camera useless unless you pay up was not smart and will end up costing any company a huge amount of money in the long run .

title: No flexibility! don't buy!!
text: Bought this product few months ago.  Works ok, the app and services are another story.   It is very controlled in services.   You have to have a paid membership to do anything.  At first, you could use and have stored for 24 hours a timeline of recordings while no canary users were at home.  You could also set a night time mode to record detected activity while canary users are at home. (Sleeping hours).  With a paid membership it allowed longer access to recordings and so on.    Well recently things have changed.  There's no option of setting a night time mode, and cannot set any of the extremely basic settings that we had before.   So now basically it sits there and prompts over any activity all day making the phone(S) with the app constantly go off while your at home.  How annoying.  I guess that was their idea with the change they made forcing you to buy the membership or not use it.   Plenty of other better options to buy without monthly memberships

title: Room for improvement
text:
Just started using this app with my canary for a few weeks. The app never properly detects when I get home even when I have my location services "Always On". There is definitely a delay and this triggers false notifications being sent to me. It would be nice if it was a "Welcome Home" notification instead, but it just thinks I'm not home still. Also, because the app is always on tracking my location, it really drains my phone battery. I think this needs to be fixed. There should be a better way (more accurate and more efficient) to detect if I'm home or not (maybe detect if my phone joins my home wifi or something like that).

The user interface of the app can also be improved. In the beginning I wanted to edit my different settings but it always just ended up switching my Canary's mode instead.

Also it would be nice if there was a way to make my canary notifications a different sound/vibration then the rest of my phone's text/notification sounds. This way I will know that it is urgent and I should check my Canary app. 

Automatic siren trigger feature when activity is detected should also be an option.  Of course this has to be after location tracking for mode switching from away to home is near 100% accurate. 

Hope to see these important must have updates soon! Otherwise great work - definitely appreciate the product so far.

title: Why the 5 star rating?
text: This security camera system is not perfect so we installed a different brand of security camera system but kept these active as a backup. Over the years we've also tried other security camera systems and realized that they too have their own faults. This system is also simple and does not require a lot of energy to run. Sure they may have not started recording an event soon enough or may have stopped recording a little too soon but they have more often recorded enough evidence for police. So the 5 star rating is based on Canary's overall consistency, cost to run and evidence collecting over the years that we've owned them. Oh and they also claim that they don't collect data from app.

title: False advertiser.
text: I cancelled my premium subscription and I still got charge! I finally got someone on the phone and they refunded my money but the reason why I cancel my subscription is because they are not good on following up to help you fix any issues you may have and I been having problems with the camera for months now and I’ve only gotten emails telling me to wait for their response for MONTHS! And in case you’re wondering no, they never did contact me after. But when it was time to renew my membership they didn’t stop sending me emails even though I cancelled my subscription! They are false advertisers, their app for Apple Watch does not work as they advertise it and they never did fix it, it seems all they care about is taking your money. It’s a shame because the camera has good quality and think it has potential if they fix the Apple Watch app and whatever it is that makes the camera go off and back online several times a day.

title: Horrible (Updated below)
text:
This app worked fine for a couple weeks then as of Aug. 26th many of the functions stopped working. Won’t let me save any changes and now my canary is in constant away mode even though the app it self shows me at home. I get no more notifications and accessing the camera is hit and miss. I have reset both machine and app., I have deleted and reinstalled app. I have turned my phone on and off and nothing has worked. Not sure what happened but without a good working app, the Canary is worthless. Can’t believe this company is still in business with this kind of performance on a so called security device. Glad it is not my only one.

UPDATE: They seemed to have finally fixed all the issues and my Canary seems to be back to proper working order. We will see how long this lasts. Gave them a couple more stars for fixing but no more until I can trust it again.

title: Disappointing
text:
I own 3 devices and I use them primarily to keep tabs on my elderly mother.  I would have probably given a 4 star rating if not for one very annoying and deal breaking feature.  
When I have the device on overnight I would expect that it would stay on and detect any movement and pick up sounds all through the night.  The feature of this app that pops up after 20-30 minutes saying "Are you still watching?" Is totally annoying and cannot be shut off.  If you are sleeping and relying on this device to monitor during the night, why should I have to wake up every 30 minutes to say yes??  If you don't, it shuts off.  Now there is the next generation of Canary launching and it is being marketed as an outdoor surveillance device.  That's not going to work well if you have to monitor it every 30 minutes to say you're still watching.  What were they thinking?  I need to look for a new system that will monitor 24/7 without interruption.

title: Buyer beware
text: I’ve had the Canary camera and am not impressed with the cameras and video. I bought it to capture my dogs antics and every time I realized there was something I wanted to see, for example, which one brought the limb in the house, the video ALWAYS had skips in the recording. This happened numerous times.  So it’s been an epic fail as I don’t get the recordings I wanted, but decided to give them another chance. So when my membership came of for renewal, due to financial issues, I opted for monthly charges instead of paying for a full year. Well again, epic failure. I get an email stating I’ll be charged the monthly fee BUT what they actually did was charged me for a full year. I have tried to get them to reverse the charges but haven’t succeeded. Also notice there isn’t a phone number you can call, only online submissions. The telephone number the bank gave me that was associated with the charge is bogus. Way to go Canary. You need to learn customer service.

title: Constant Connection Issues.
text: This camera system is usually pretty good - unless you count the endless barrage of connectivity alerts. The app and the cams are down constantly lately. The cameras themselves work great. But this is a hugely flawed system. I have 3 Canary Pros and a Canary Flex and I have had them for a couple years now. I take care of them and have been incredibly disappointed with the amount of times my devices go offline per day and in fact, the reason I got rid of my membership was due to the persistent connection issues. All of my cameras have been constantly offline despite having perfect connection to wifi. A serious letdown, and not being ableTo easily contact support does not help. Reporting an incident should never be this hard.  Fix your connection issues Canary team. A lot of people rely on these cams and have spent some good money on them expecting them to perform properly.

title: Not reliable
text: We’ve had the Canary system for about a year now. At first it worked wonderfully and the app was reliable. Unfortunately the quality and consistency has decreased significantly. Along with the other reviewers we continually have issues with cameras going offline, delayed notifications, video feed cutting out during live viewing, and app crashes. It’s not an occurrence just once in a while either. It’s pretty much not operating daily at some point. We have done all the trouble shooting customer service has suggested- change geolocation, reload app, relaunch modems, you name it. I’m really disappointed in this. I wanted to like this product and the service and we spent some time researching and it seemed to be abterr for for our family than Ring, but now I regret that we purchased it. Until they spend some time and $ with improvements I can’t recommend this product.

title: Terrible product, should be 0 stars
text:
The app crashes very often and there has been no improvement with all of the updates, if anything it’s gotten worse.
 Canary support is just about as useless as the product itself, there is no phone number, only texting or IM support, what kind of company doesn’t have a phone number??  
We bought the canary Flex and all-in-one because we were having issues with apartment maintenance letting them selves in our unit and leaving the door unlocked.  The air quality sensor is useless, if you cook anything or use any cleaning chemicals it goes nuts.  The canary flex is junk too,  the motion detection is intermittent at best, even after “masking” problem areas, it still sees things that aren’t there.  It does a great job at recording shadows and the occasional bird, but not at seeing the person breaking in to my truck.  Do not buy this product, the subscription and hardware are all a waste of money.  After my year subscription is up, this camera will be going in the trash.

title: App GUI is awesome. Video playback ~8 sec delay
text:
The app itself is great. Installation was a breeze. Linking to my Canary Flex was simple. The camera/mount/plugs are all made very well and I have nothing bad to say about the hardware. 

My only gripe is with the software itself.  I like the mode switching and the auto switch abilities. The app integrates seamlessly with the apple iOS.  The only issue is the delay when viewing live video, and when detecting to record.  There is a serious delay when motion detection recording starts as well as the actual live feed itself. 
When I review the recording, I only see the person in the screen. I don't see the right seconds prior where the person is walking towards the camera etc. This is a deal breaker for me as I would like to see everything that it is supposed to record when detecting motion. 
Live view has the same issue. Delay of about 8 seconds. Compared to my DeeLink camera (which has about half a second of delay) this is absolutely horrible. I'm returning the camera today.

title: Can Canary Cut It?
text:
Has gone from disappointing to good and I’m confident will be a 5 star device soon.

I had been following Canary before the product became available to customers and was thrilled at the “buzz” I had been seeing. I previously had a Panasonic three camera system (I could pan and tilt, hear audio, from my hotel in London and Edinburg) but it was a Royal pain to set up and keep running. Samsung was a big disappointment too… and along comes Canary.

Mine arrived in late January. Set up was simple and easy (pros hooked up my Panasonic and Samsung… both now paper weights). The Canary worked well for the first week then the problems.

Numerous “server outages” and app problems. A firmware update seemed to put me back in good shape and then reliability problems happened again. 

The Canary has a “learn” mode to instruct it to ignore certain movement (such as pets, etc) and I spent a good deal of time “teaching” Canary but I think the big server malfunction of 3-24 lost al my data. 

The new app released soon after seems to resolve a lot of the problems, however I am don’t know why the Canary is arming itself without me going though the app on my iPhone. 

Still a few kinks in Canary, but the technical support has been very helpful and prompt. I feel very confident that Canary will work as I need it as a home security system…

title: Canary has become user UNFRIENDLY
text:
This application and service was better when it was free. I now have a $15 a month membership, and never know when it’s going to work. I sometimes go to look in, and will not receive any live feed whatsoever. After many minutes passed, I gave up.

Recently, I have tried looking in through the app to my house over the last couple of days and it has never worked. I contacted customer support and ask them why I wasn’t being told that it was either off-line or not receiving a signal. The customer service agent said we can “troubleshoot“ the system. This included on installing the application, turning off all the cameras and then reinstalling everything. This means that my house was unprotected for days, nothing was being recorded and I never would have noticed my house was broken into or something else had occurred.

When this was a free app, everything always worked quickly, efficiently and I was able to contact a live customer service representative.

Now, customer service is just some crappy email /chat through the app feature with people who have no idea what they’re doing. It’s crazy to think that I depended on them to keep my house and belongings secure. It would cost about five dollars a month more to go through my cable provider for a security system with cameras and at least it would probably work 99.9% of the time.

title: Canary using hostage tactics on long-time members
text: My review is based on what this company is now doing to its long-time customers. I have had three of their devices for quite a few years. I purchased them based on what they could do and NOT having to sign up for any monthly fees. Initially, the membership was just to allow more event storage but now they have removed functionality that we used to have which makes these devices essentially useless in most typical scenarios where you need to have some cameras on and recording and others off. "Home" mode is an "all or nothing" proposition and night mode isn't even accessible. What's next Canary? Are we going to have to sign up just to see video soon?? Of course, you can pay their ransom and have the devices you previously payed hundreds of dollars for returned to their previous functionality. Convenient indeed! But I digress. Maybe their corporate headquarters were taken over by Ukrainian ransomware hackers and this is not really their fault...

title: Love my Canary
text:
I’ve had my Canary system for about two and a half years and I love it. The cameras are very clear even at night when it’s dark! The system will alert you when there’s any movement in the home and it has great features when you attach it to your mobile device. I pay less than $10 and I can hook several cameras to my account. 
I travel quite often and having the system gives me peace of mind; I can check in on my family and my house at anytime I can  listen in and talk to the family through the system too.
The Canary is not hard wired so I can plug it in and move at anytime. The sIren feature is great because it is loud and quite frightening when you sound it (it would deter any intruder). Great system! 
Vee H

title: Works great for me....
text: Can't understand why all the one star reviews.  This app does for me exactly what I bought the Canary for.. security.  Sounds like some people want it for a spy camera to record all the time for whatever reason....  if I'm away from home and there's movement in view of the camera, it notifies me and the I have the options to sound the siren, phone emergency numbers or just view what's going on. And while I'm at home, it still will record movements, but won't notify me... And it does exactly that.  And I read some of the reviews that it sounds like some people don't know what they're doing or how to operate this device..  My advice to them is to take the security camera back and get a dog...  Could the app be better?  Yes and in time I'm confident it will and for now it does what it's supposed to do....

title: Almost Exceptional For Portable Security
text:
I actually love this device and app. It wasn’t hard to setup at all for me, but for some people who are not tech savvy, it may take a moment to get used to it and figure out how to actually get the software to work more accurately. I’m still on a free trial and I’m getting all the features the app offers. 

The only thing I would have loved is for the air quality to not just report abnormal, but report exactly what is abnormal about the air quality. I know when I’m cooking and if there is smoke then it can give me this alarm, but it doesn’t let me know what exactly is abnormal about the air quality despite the fact that the device can test for all these abnormal air quality issues.

I would do 4.5 stars but it only allows whole star ratings.

title: Dishonest business practices
text:
I've had the canary about 1 year now. When if first came out it had some bugs as far as the camera being to sensitive and sending out way too many false alarms. Canary has fixed that now by adding a sensitivity setting to the app. They have also made multiple other improvements to the app that has made for a better experience. The camera itself takes a reasonably good quality video and also records sound. It also has pretty good night vision. 

Now the reason for the 1 star review. If you sign up for a subscription service you can't go back to the free option unless you email their support team. All the other options you can select through the app. They have purposely made it difficult to switch back to free in order to keep charging people. I don't like this type of business practice. Treat your customers with honesty and respect. 

Change that setting and I'll change the rating on this review.

title: Used to be ok..
text:
I did know if Canary totally screwed things over with the last update but recently it signed me out of my app and I cannot sign back in... After putting credentials in it freezes 1/4 of the progress wheel on “Authorizing” but never signs me in. Then I get an email saying there was a login but I couldn’t use the app!!!! I have already paid Canary prepaid subscription now for nothing. They have my money for a critical service I cannot access!!!

I reinstalled and power cycled my phone and everything! When I emailed support they quickly resorted to my phone not being compatible. I have an iPhone XR, listed as compatible, and they said I have to have iOS 13.x or later, I have 14.x, latest update!!! Calling their support number gives you a message that they can’t answer due to volume and you need to text or email. This is ridiculous! I no longer recommend Canary in any way shape or form to my worst enemy.

title: Old iPhone won’t work
text: I have an iPhone 6 Plus. All of a sudden-no dice. Will not work. I contacted customer support. They said ios too old. I lose. Have four cameras that will not work with this. I know-my phone is old. But lots of other products are still supported. I get the “unable to connect at this time” message. Can’t even sign in to the app. I was offered 50% off their online service. I will probably buy some cheap cameras until September when I get a new phone. Then I will revisit this. The original iPhone SE is the last iPhone that will receive the latest updates and work otherwise you were out of luck. Of course you have a brand new phone or a newer one.

title: I've tried like it, but I can't
text: I don't like give a bad review. But it's necessary. I have a Flex for almost two years. This camera never works like a cctv camera. I paid for one year and it's not work good yet. The problem is that system don't save all moving and when save, it's a partial move. Sometimes I receive movement alerts but sometimes not. Camera have a bad image most of time. At night the camera sensor looks lights like day (don't have a good sensor system). Don't waste your money paying for nothing. Because when I paid, the only thing that is different is microphone. Images and moved is same. It's crazy that system stop a move while a guy is walking! If someone wants stole my tools in my truck, he don't be afraid about this camera, because it will not save him in completely moving. Just a part of his approach. I tried. Promise. But I didn't saw any changes to give a better review in two year. Sorry.

title: Unreliable, not dependable...
text: Unreliable, not dependable...I had so many issues that I don’t have enough time to describe them all here! Simply one of my worst purchases ever! I have 4 devices and I have had issues with them all to the point that now I rather simply spend more $ and purchase another system to replace the Canary. It has been 18 months of nothing but issues with the devices and the app and what was supposed to be a piece of mind, has simply being nothing but headaches. There is always a connectivity issue and if you have a surveillance camera to provide piece of mind when you are away, having constant connectivity issues that requires on site attention surely defeats the purpose of safety and piece of mind right? Anyhow, too many issues to name them all here. If you want a reliable and dependable systems, stay always from this product.

title: Look else where for a security camera.
text: Like many others who have reviewed this product this is not a great device and I would suggest looking elsewhere. I pay for the yearly service at $99 and I don’t believe this camera system is worth it and there are many better systems out there I have four of their cameras set up throughout the house indoor and outdoor. The biggest problem for me is that the notifications are very delayed sometimes up to two minutes. If someone is at my door or is approaching my house like the deliveryman the window of recording shows the approach and as the delivery vehicle is leaving I don’t even see the mailman dropped off a package to the front of my house. And unlike a nest that continuously record 24/7 this device only records moments prior to a movement and nothing in between and after the movement has stopped it defeats the purpose of having a security camera.

title: Amazing!!!!
text:
Wow... This thing is amazing. If not only for peace of mind (My boyfriend works late so I usually am the first one to our apartment.) I love the fact that I can check on my dog at any point of the day. 

Setup:
Super simple! Took me about 15 minutes. The app you download walks you through it step by step. 

The app:
I have an Iphone 6+ and it looks great. I love that you can see when you and your household members leave and come home as well as all the data that it collects about the space (air, temperature, humidity)

The Canary:
WAY smaller than I thought it was going to be. Super easy to hide away so its not super obvious what it is. The design is nice too. It doesn't look totally out of place. I also like the indicator light on the bottom so you know if its on or not if your phone isn't super cool.

The quality of the camera exceeded my expectations. I can't believe it can get our whole apartment with just one canary. I live  in a one bedroom so it's not huge but the wide angle is great. Also the fact that they have night vision is really cool!

You should definitely try this out. Its so much cheaper than a typical system and the technology is great!

title: Goodbye from a loyal Promoter
text: I have been using the Canary for sometime and also work in the industry in a way where I am frequently giving information to customers around which HomeKit and smart home accessories that they should utilize. Canary has long been by go to for low cost / full featured home security. With the recent changes made and the amount of features now hidden behind a paywall, I will now not only be discontinuing my own use of my Canary, I will no longer be recommending it to anyone for use in their own home. All too often have I seen developers want to make customers pay for new and exciting features that come to their products as they grow, but I have never seen anyone strip all the critical functions from an existing device and render it almost useless especially considering I bought it with an understanding of the complimentary functionality. Sorry Canary, it’s been great but I’m on my way out the door to by a new home camera.

title: I like it
text:
We primarily use canary to monitor our 20 month old. The video quality exceeds expectation and it's really nice to know the temperature, humidity and air quality in his room. It has improved our quality of life.

We do experience the false alerts when night vision goes on and off but it doesn't bug me that much. It would be great to get alerts when temp/humidity/air quality spikes so I can go open a window or adjust the thermostat. Also the lock screen gets disoriented in landscape mode and I have to shut the app down and restart in portrait mode to be able to reach all the buttons.

All around, works great for what we use it for. And nice that it has a purpose when we no longer need a baby monitor.

title: App still Buggy
text:
I've had Canary for about two weeks now and the app is very buggy. It's a shame because the device itself is very sleek and aesthetically appealing. It blends nicely into the background and video is clear, even in low light.
Biggest cons on the app seem to be software related, which is surprising given the delayed rollout date and user testing that occurred.
- geofencing still not 100%. There is a delay in the recognition of when users leave/come home. As a result, it is easier to just arm and disarm manually
- interface for arming/disarming. When you select the option for setting the mode on the Canary, a pop up box opens. Unfortunately on my iPad, the circle for privacy mode overlaps another option,  the option for other user. As such I cannot select Privacy Mode as I am always kicked out to the option for Other User. This is not an issue on our iPhone. I wish the app would auto-rotate which should resolve the issue, or open a more vertical pop up box.
- alerting features not 100%. I adjusted the settings on both of our devices per the Canary instructions but alerts are still not coming over consistently. Sometimes we get the notification, sometimes we don't.

Overall, I'm not impressed with the product so far and hope that they will be rolling out updates.

title: Great start..... and then they became greedy.
text:
I’ve had my canary for about two years now and this latest update took features away that makes it almost useless if you don’t subscribe. 

I don’t feel secure with this device anymore because they’ve taken away “Night mode” for the free users. So basically if you’re home it does not record period. 

I use to enjoy the peace of mind I had knowing that if someone were to break in at night it would be recorded but now that that feature has been taken away. I really want to sell this device and find something better only.... 

I have no idea who would buy this device with the lack of features.

Also the free users used to have 2-3 days of recordings and now they’ve limited to 24 hours. 

How do you screw up so badly canary. 

This device used to be a great device without a subscription and now it’s really shameful what you’ve done to make a little more money. 

If it’s having a big use base that doesn’t subscribe that is the issue... reengineer the device to have local storage to make it auto sufficient and not use your servers. If it cost money for that upgrade I’ll surely pay it to keep you from having to buy a subscription. 

If you haven’t bought a canary. Don’t.

I will update this review if things improve but I have a feeling that they won’t. 

Make this product great again Canary....

title: Frustrated...
text:
Well, I still see a huge benefit to Canary. I do wish there was a way to tone down the video quality. It takes up so much bandwidth during the day I set it to privacy while I'm home. I would prefer disarmed, but the Canary uses all available bandwidth and leaves virtually nothing for me & hubby when we are working from home. No one can understand me when I'm on a VoIP call.

Ever since this most recent update I have occasionally received alerts when Canary is operating in "Privacy" mode. Also, it keeps erroneously reporting I've left my house changing to "Armed" when I'm home, phone is with me and I've set it to "Disarmed". I've also  noticed upon launching l the app to switch modes it has crashed several times.

I'm not sure what went wrong when with the Canary itself or the software app, but right now I am not sure there's added benefit to having it on. I am very close to just unplugging it.

title: App is unreliable, hardware is nice...
text:
I've been using Canary since the day it was released to Indigogo backers. The hardware build quality is great the the app is really bad. 

- App almost never auto-arms. I can open the app away or at home and it's almost always incorrect about my location. I need to force quit the app to make it detect my location. 
- "Home Health" data works the same way. I often need to force quit the app to make it update the stats. 
- No historical home health data. You get 24 hours, that it. No way to actually see trends with 24 hour's worth of data. Also no way to export the data. 
- No way to export videos. I can see them wanting to store the data on their servers so they can charge you, but individual videos should be downloadable. What if you actually had to give the videos to law enforcement. 
- IR night vision triggers the motion sensor. I get an activity alert every time the sun goes down when the IR lights turn for night vision. 

Also, not a down side, but it would be great if you could get some kind of notifications when temp/humidity/air quality changes drastically or at an interval you set. Maybe email notifications rather than relying on an unreliable app? IFTTT integration would be awesome too. I'd love to turn on my air conditioners plugged into WeMo outlets whenever it gets too hot.

title: Have owned for years
text:
Seems like it may be one of the better setups on the market; atleast comparible but can use work. 
I have 40gb internet speed at home, should be enough but cameras always take some time to load; anywhere from 15secs to infinity...even when it sends me a notification that I want to check or just monitoring on my own. 
Reception distance is pretty good. Cameras go offline more often than I think they should and come online either right away or after minutes or hours; a lot less reliable than a wires system but convenient. 
Battery can last weeks or longer depending on activity. Sometimes they dont charge when placed on charger and have to have connector removed and reattached; magnetic so its quick. 
Overall I would really like something more reliable. Picture Is pretty good too.

title: Complete waste of time scam criminals

It’s been months since I was attacked in my home and I cannot download a copy of the surveillance footage because this app is HORRIBLE …at this point I feel like CANARY works with the criminals because they have done absolutely nothing to resolve this issue but asking me to redownload the app over x over again..this is ridiculous and I have to continue paying for the premium service just to have access to evidence of a crime committed against me... it makes no sense how I can download other footage but cannot gain any access to the footage of this crime ...wish I used a better company and never came across these incompetent people

title: What did you do????
text: This latest update is horrible. Just horrendous!!!   Now features that we used over a year we have to pay for?   That’s not right.  I depend on night mode every night I can’t use that feature.  9.99 month for you to do what?  I bought it and agreed to buy this based on what it offered I don’t think it’s right to one day just switch everything off. Even home mode you can’t use the camera.  Make it right...  make it right!!!!

title: Not Reliable
text: Very unreliable and disappointing  camera system. When I need to toggle between cameras at one location the entire system drops off line. If I can’t reactivate a remote camera they suggest I unplug and reset camera. Doesn’t that defeat the purpose of a remote security camera ? I have added wifi enabled plugs to remotely reset cameras but it seems the operating system should recognize and  resolve the power problem. The cameras also click and activate a light when night vision is used when trying to monitor a property, not very stealthy. The batteries on the remote cameras last 2-3 days , not much help monitoring a distant location. Often I must remove app and reinstall Canary app, re-sign in and hope that one of my four cameras will deliver a picture and perhaps environmental info that was promised.  Nice looking equipment and reasonable customer service but the system is flawed and unreliable.

title: Support
text:
I’ve had this system for awhile and support was available by phone but that does not seem to be the case anymore.

The system will activate upon motion but not remain on and recording.   For example, when the post office, UPS or FedEx deliver the two outside may activate.   At least one usually does but it does not continue recording the entire time the activity is going on.  It will catch the vehicle pull up and catch activity inside the vehicle but the. Shuts off when the person gets out or shortly after they get out.  So if it was someone with nefarious activity in their heart you might get to see them show up but the camera would not catch the activity itself.

I have these cameras at my office and the same thing is happening.  Will catch the movement then stop recording while the person is mid-step in front of the camera.

Additionally, I removed a user from the account but the system has not removed them and in fact, has assigned my phone to them so when I leave it will only show a few moments of me leaving but when the other user leaves the system sends a notification that I left.

I cannot find any settings or way to change either one of the problems and when clicking on the help button all I get is the offer to watch tutorials.

title: Overall Good
text: I have the canary and so far so good. I love the wide angle of the camera and the different modes. I have had no problem with the camera going offline. The app always connects quickly. For living alone the modes work just fine for me. I love that i can talk to my dogs, and even people who come in. I pay for the monthly service for extra security. The one concern I have is the alert sound for the motion sensor. When I’m awake, the canary sound is fine. However if I’m asleep and someone is in my house, I need something that is going to wake me up. My normal iPhone text sound nor the canary sound will wake me up. I really hope this can be addressed so I can have total peace of mind with this system.

title: Spotty at best
text: I have two outside cameras and 3 inside. I have been frequently getting notifications on my phone and then nothing in the app timeline. Just today someone came over at my request and fed the animals and were in clear view of 4 of my 5 cameras and absolutely NOTHING showed up! Ridiculous, thinking of going to Arlo or another competitor that is more reliable. The wifi signal to all cameras is strong and i can watch a live feed so there is no reason these cameras should be losing coverage and certainly no reason why i should get the notification and then the app shows nothing in the timeline. This company hasnt really made any improvements or advances in at least 3 years in my opinion so it must be an indicator that they have peaked or are in decline. Consider other platforms if you want reliable performance I think.

title: Canary cares about profits over your family’s safety!!!
text:
WARNING!!! Stay away!!! WORST COMPANY EVER!!!

Canary makes a home security camera. This is a company that should keep your home and family safe, right? WRONG!!!

title: Pay & Delay
text:
I bought this camera because it is wireless, weather proof, and would soon have the talk feature. 

Well, now the talk feature is finally here but you want your customers to pay for a feature that is free on cameras costing as little as $29 and probably less.

When the camera is not plugged in it is worthless. I had so many videos of the back of peoples heads. They would come to my door and by the time they were leaving the camera kicks in. Hope people can be identified by the back of their head. 

The "solution" was to plug the camera in. ... So much for "wireless".  I ended up plugging it in inside pointing out a window. ... Weatherproof no longer needed. The reasons why I chose to do this. 1. The weatherproof plug does not come with the camera. 2. The easiest way to remove the camera from the "secure" mount is to simply unscrew the camera from the mount. ...no hex wrench or tiny hex screwdriver necessary. 

Still a 10 second delay, even after this latest "update". 

The camera is largely a failure. The battery option is useless. After paying hundreds of dollars they still want to nickle and dime you. The only thing I will be paying for is return shipping.

Update - I returned it last night and bought a Yi Home 2. More features, better resolution, and no monthly payments, all for $59.  ...and 4.5 star review average on their app.

title: Device is now a brick. Buyer Beware!
text: I noticed that the device stopped functioning completely a couple of days ago, so I tried to call Canary on their support phone line, only to learn that they no longer provide phone support. They listed email, chat, and texting options on their website, so I tried to use their chat option, but their chat window is broken on my phone. I then texted them and they got back to me within about 20 minutes. They asked me to provide my email address, which I did. They then asked me to provide my name, which I did. They then told me that they had no such customer on file and they could not help me further. I then sent an email message to their support email address, pasting the transcript of the text support conversation. I've not heard back from them since. The device has essentially become a brick, or, maybe I can use it as a paperweight, as that's all it's good for now.

title: They have made their own device useless with Automatic Set To Private
text: I used to like the Canary until they set it to automatically turn off everytime anyone walks in the house. Why work so hard making this device and then automatically turn it off constantly? The other day my mom calls me from our home phone because she hears noises upstairs and wants me to check the camera to make sure there isn't someone breaking in. Her cell is upstairs so she can't check the canary. I tell her No problem, give me one second and I will make sure it's safe. I go to my Canary screen and it's Set to Private so I can't see anything because a member is home. What's the point of having cameras in the house if we can't use them when we need to!? I guess it didn't occur to the developers that customers are using this for elder care, child care, etc. Situations where a member is home, but other members may need to check in and make sure they are ok.

title: Was gold, now garbage.
text:
The first year and a half, both the customer service and the app/user experience was solid. Not the best, but better than most. 

Recently, over the course of the last 6months, everything about the app got worse and worse. I started getting more connection problems despite being hardwired (narrowed the issue to the canary device). Eventually reset to factory settings. 

Now the last few weeks have been a notification nightmare, rendering the device completely useless. Even with timer and geofence and manual settings, the app will not recognize I’m at “Home”. Constantly leaves me on “Away”, despite manually selecting “Home”. So every time I move out of my set mask, I get notified. My large dog sets it off all night long when me moves around in his sleeping spots. Leaving me with 3 options... 1. Set a mask for my entire room which would do absolutely nothing. 2. Turn off notifications, which would mean I wouldn’t know if there’s an emergency. 3. Turn off the app/device. Also rendering the system useless. 

Tl;dr- before all these updates and “monthly monitoring” pop ups, the app and camera were perfect. In 6 months it went to hell. Save yourself the money and time and buy an Arlo or Dropcam/Nest. 

Side note: CREATE A “REPORT ISSUE” LINK. I searched the app in nearly every window and didn’t see a thing.

text:
THANKS CANARY FOR MAKING ME MISS THE CRIMINALS WHO BROKE INTO 7 Vehicles!!!  No longer am I able to view Home Mode OR RECORD VIDEO when a member is home

title: FALL FROM GRACE!!!!
text: Once upon a time, I purchased a Canary security camera. It came with an AMAZING app that used to work almost flawlessly. But that was “a long long time ago in a galaxy far far away”. Fast forward to today: the Canary camera spends more time OFFLINE than it does ONLINE, supposedly constantly watching over my apartment. At least two times a day, EVERY DAY…..!!!!…I get a message saying that the camera is offline. It goes offline and comes back on at will with a freaking mind of it’s own. And it’s connected right next to the router and modem via Ethernet cable, and none of my other devices lose connection like this thing does. And on top of that, the app…is TRASH! The Canary system, which used to be a wonderful way to keep track of security in my apartment, is a shell of it’s former self. It may be time to start looking elsewhere for another security cam solution. And that’s a shame.

title: Used To Be Good, Useless Now
text:
I first got a Canary 2 years ago and it worked well enough. However since then they’ve been slowly removing features and options that used to be available right out of the box. Now, on top of purchasing the device in the first place, you have to pay for a separate membership plan in order to get features that make the thing worthwhile. I can’t help but feel scammed, now I have to pay more money if I actually want to see what the camera records for more than just a few seconds when I’m not home and as of today I can’t even have it record while home - that is apparently now also something only available with a membership. 

I wonder what else they’ll remove in the future... will it get to the point where you need to pay monthly just to use the thing at all? I will definitely be looking for an alternative solution and I suggest you do the same.

title: I’m really happy with Canary!
text: I have two of these devices in my home and while the initial setup and software update wasn’t as smooth as I would have expected (my Ring doorbell and ecobee were super smooth), they have been running without difficulty and have been reliable. I like the air quality alerts but I really wish it would have more specific details on those alerts; I def want to know about Co2 but may care less about other things. My only real gripe is that I trust Apple HomeKit a lot more than a company like Canary (nothing personal) and these devices really should be using HomeKit so I could better use their data for automation. e.g. my Canary devices are more accurate than my ecobee’s temperature sensor.

title: Not what I expected
text: I passed this camera on a discount rack at Walmart,....wondering why it was only $45 cuz it looked like a nice cam,....so I get it take it home hook it up to my WiFi that I pay for monthly as it is,..I find out that you have to pay monthly for the services,..lil disappointed since I already have a merkury  camera that offers everything for free and it was only $25.....this canary isn't terrible and I wouldn't mind paying for subscription if you could take it with you anywhere and use with your phone 4G-3G/Bluetooth  or something ,...I'll probably take it back it does have some unnecessary features like air quality that I don't give 2 dingle berries about....I can find that anywhere like the news or just open the front door and take a whiff ,....but anywho that's my take on the canary

text:
I have been a Canary user since late 2016. The hardware is phenomenal. Clear, crisp, and performs well at night. However, the biggest issue is not the hardware for the service. IT IS THE APP. It is useless, making the hardware useless. Logging into my account to gain access to app is next to impossible. It freezes as it tries to authorize my user information.
