title: Bad upgrades
text:
It seems that Canary has changed their focus on providing a great customer experience, great app and good cameras to generating more money and fleecing its customers. 

 The App has been garbage since iOS 14 was released back in September. The Apple Watch app has not worked since that date. The Canary  App seems to have a problem with newer iPhones and newer Watches. Contacting customer support for the these software issues have not resolved them. Before you place your regular response below, yes I have been a premium “paying”customer since your initial go fund me days.

With no HomeKit support (yeah, you have been evaluating that for over four years now!) and the software issues that seem to occur because you keep adding bloat features (professional monitoring) in order to monetize mo’ money from customers instead of cleaning up issues with the Canary App and devices, I will be looking elsewhere for a HomeKit compatible security camera/devices and I would advise others that read this to do the same, especially if you are an iOS / Apple user (Canary Focus is not on you or your devices). 

I hate to be negative and slam a product or company but this review is truthful and I hope it helps others looking to keep their families, homes, businesses or belongings SAFE.

title: Canary flex worthless
text: I've been using an old iPhone with an app I got for free off of the App Store. I needed something wireless that had battery. I bought the canary flex and it's worthless. I got it hooked up, charged the battery and it and my phone understand each other fine. I have a fast internet connection and then"live feed" is horrible. I can't see live video. It's choppy even on the same network. I set it to away and walked around in front of it for over an hour. It noticed me once. I went to work and it never went off once even though I have a dog walking around all day. When I try to look at the live feed it's a still image from movement it caught of me hours ago. The old iPhone and app works 100 times better. I'd have thought for a dedicated wireless security camera that it would have worked better. It doesn't. Save your money. The idea of a wireless / cordless camera seemed great but don't bother.

title: App keeps crashing
text: I used to have a glowing opinion of this app and service. At first it was wonderful. I got the camera 5 years ago, and although the setup took a while, once set up it worked great. So much so, that I subscribed to the premium service. **** that has all changed now. I’m not sure if the app needs updated or what , but now ever action in the app signs me out. Watch live? Nope, I get signed out. View timeline? Nope, I get signed out. Try going to the settings? Nope, same thing. I have the newest iPhone at this time (12 Pro Max) and always have my software up to date. The app needs fixed. I contacted support and thought it was going to get fixed, but after 10 days with no updates I shouldn’t expect anything. I guess thankfully at this time I can’t update my payment information in the app to my new card, so I’m not being charged anymore.

title: Disappointed
text:
I agree with most of the complaints in the other reviews. I’m very disappointed in the app at this point. It seemed to work fine during the 60 day trial period provided when I bought the Canary but hasn’t worked properly on and off for the last 2 months or so. 
My problems with the app are as follows:
1.      When we both leave the house at the same time, it oftentimes doesn’t recognize that both of us are gone. This means that we have to arm it manually because the auto feature does not work.
2.      The same thing happens when we return to the house.
3.      The Canary app on my wife’s iPhone 4S does not recognize that the wireless network setting is turned on. She keeps getting messages that the location services work better when the wireless network is activated. The wireless network setting on her phone is always turned on and the wireless home network is working just fine.
4.      We constantly receive notifications of activity in the house. This is for things like sunshine, shadows, and lamps automatically turning on/off. I’ve been tagging such activity for months but it doesn’t seem to matter.

As mentioned above, I’m very disappointed in this device. It has not come close to living up to the features listed in the advertising.

title: No Complaints! Great Customer Service
text:
The app has worked pretty well for me in the nine months I’ve had it. The troubleshooting for it is pretty easy should anything happen; and when my device did get wonky, it was easy to get ahold of help from a representative who responded very quickly to my emails and offered solutions that actually worked. 

Love the peace of mind I get when I leave my home or go to bed. It’s great that it can sense when I get far away so that it activates the surveillance mode or whatever. I also love the microphone feature because I have pets at home that I can speak to (annoy) when I’m away!

title: Unending false positives, required paid membership.
text:
I’ve had my Canary camera for well over a year, and have found it to be pretty worthless as a security camera, for the following reasons:

- it issues an overwhelmingly high number of alerts, pretty much all of which are false positives. EG: there is a tree outside my window, and whenever the wind blows, the shadow it casts into my apartment changes. Canary’s image processing algorithms are unable to distinguish this as non-human activity. 

- on the only occasion when someone DID enter my apartment while I was away, canary failed to send a notification. It did record video, but sent no notification. Thankfully: this was not an intruder but a plumber my landlord had sent in to perform a repair. The only reason I noticed the recorded video was I had expected them to enter and was interested in seeing whether or not I would be notified.

- adding insult to injury, Canary added a requirement that you subscribe to their paid member services to download even a single video. For the first year or so you had a basic membership (which only makes since, having paid for their $300 camera). Apparently they’ve decided to stop doing this.

Overall: this is a pretty terrible product. I’m planning on replacing mine with something better soon.

title: Canary WORKS
text:
I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews. I've had it for 3 months now and the canary does what it's supposed to. It's wonderful. It has had moments where there have been software glitches but a simple unplugging and replugging restarts it and fixes it right up. If there are any concerns, their customer service department is really fast with their turn around and help you solve any issues you may have. 
MY ONLY COMPLAINT is that they should include a feature that allows me to tell my dog to stay off my sofa while I am away through the crispy speaker that the camera already has. This will make this better than anything I've ever invested in.

title: Frequent, long semi-outages. Forced upgrade.
text:
The uptime page is misleading; when they have a multi-day outages, which is often, they never show it as being more than one day. 

Poor company. They keep coming up with new products and features without fixing their core service. There areSuch a large percentage of unhappy customers filing complaints all over the place and unlike most company’s complaints they’re generally not from clueless people. It’s people who are conscientious (organized and careful) that tend to buy such products. So. 

OLD: Forced Upgrade: I have no idea why but the Canary app completely stopped working even after forced restarts. It couldn't connect to the server at all. While other apps worked fine.  I jut updated and it's at least somewhat useable now, but the bad reviews scare me. Wish I hadn't been forced to upgrade.

title: Buggy Software
text:
With the latest update, the Canary constantly goes off-line, can’t actually tell what I’m actually home, gets stuck in “Away” mode, and keeps sending me alerts that someone is in the home. It’s possible these issues are due to the iOS 14 update, but at the very least Canary should alert their users they are working on a fix. 2 Star rating until this gets resolved.

Below is my original review from several years ago.

I had some technical issues with my first generation Canary, and tech support diligently solved my problem. They didn't give up until mission accomplished. It's interesting to see the evolution of their software, carefully fine-tuning and adding features with each update. Keep up the good work, as it's much appreciated!

title: Could be better, especially if you pay for the membership.
text:
Overall I like the Canary app and service. Video quality is great and I’ve had no issues in that realm. 

The app itself could use some improvement. We have two canaries and want more, however it’s a huge bummer I can’t see a screen that shows all the cameras at once. I have to slide to each one and wait for it to load, pretty frustrating as this is a basic feature on other camera apps. It’s a great feature, especially if we’ve spent the money on another canary. Also, the motion sensor isn’t perfect and you can miss activity, you should have at least 24 hours of video you can go back through, not just if canary detects motion. If you guys could add this I’d rate 5 stars. Thanks!

title: It’s a no go.
text: I’ve had Canary for about a year. Was fine with the changes, and even gave them props for getting a faster response time. All this changed when today came about. Canary completely destroyed the whole use of this camera. Everything is now behind a paywall, I used to be able to set Night Mode Scheduling, which now costs money. I used to view little recorded moments that was taken when my and my wife were home, now that is no longer, it is behind a paywall. Everything is now behind a paywall. What a useless device, I now am looking for alternatives! This is the upmost worst update that you guys have came out with. Now Canary is almost considered useless for me. I might as well sell it to someone else and buy a Logitech (which doesn’t charge!). This is a joke of a product and company, completely doing a 180° turn on all customers with this update. Screw you guys.

title: Still needs a lot of work
text:
I switched back to Canary after several months of using a nest camera - A lot of the features Canary offers for free on the basic plan requires a service plan on nest. I guess you kind of get what you pay for (or in this case, don't) because the biggest holding Canary back are software issues. 

-My camera randomly goes offline 2-3 times a week. Yesterday it was down for several hours (think this was a wide outage for everyone) 

-Motion notifications are sent out randomly (some days I'll get a notification for every event, other days I'll have 15 events in my timeline but no notifications). 

-My camera is set to go into Night mode from 11pm to 6am. At 6am it switches into Home mode until I leave for work. When we were recently on vacation it still switched into Night mode, but at 6am it kept going into Home mode, and staying there all day, despite no one being home. I had to manually switch it back to away mode each morning. 

-Getting the Apple Watch app to work required (as suggested by Canary support) uninstalling the Canary app, switching my iPhone clock ahead two days, rebooting my phone, reinstalling the Canary app, rebooting, and then switching the time back.

title: No longer waste
text:
See update below. 

When first purchased 2 cameras (May 2016) worked perfectly fine. Next update turned both cameras into worthless bricks.  Customer support very accommodating but bottom line - my wifi connection is no longer fast enough. No way I can change that!!  Can you say "bait and switch"??!!!?!! 

Update:  16 months later and we finally have high speed internet...and our canaries both work. There are minor quirks with the system, i.e., thinks my husband is away when he's not and his geofence is correct.  Will some day worry about that.  Just glad to get a return on our investment after all this time.  Overall, cameras work as expected originally.

title: Don’t waste your money with Canary
text:
Promised free month of service but charged for “membership” immediately.  Away mode - no notifications even when set to notify. 
All “recorded” video is chopped up if you are lucky enough to get anything at all, even with a very fast connection. 
I would avoid this bad joke. Overpriced and doesn’t work. Keep up the hard work Canary.
Update: features now removed unless you subscribe to their membership which is very overpriced. Streaming live video will freeze and will only stream in very low definition if at all, even while in the same room with 1000m high speed. This company is run by amateurs and will fail in the next 18 months. We will all be left with very expensive paper weights. I would strongly recommend against purchasing this product.  I regret my purchase, probably the most useless thing I have bought in the past decade.

title: Bait and Switch
text: I bought a Canary in the very earliest stages and told all my friends and family about the company, and how wonderful everything was. It worked so great for a long time, then they started adding memberships to support longer video storage, and extra features. I was fine with with the minimal recording time, as I don’t take many trips and I can just review the videos each day. With the new update, you can’t watch live when at home, and video clips are cut to only 30 seconds. Why is Canary putting customer’s safety as risk, for a higher return for them. If they really cared about safety, they would keep the basic features free to protect loyal customers (I’ve been one for the first pre-order days) who bought the device to not have a monthly fee. I’m disappointed in myself for believing it would stay so awesome. If it seems too good to be true...it usually is.

title: Horrible App - Slow / Doesn’t Work
text:
I’ve had a canary for about 2 years now, the app is at its absolute worst right now to where I don’t even go on it anymore, therefore making the canary USELESS. When I try to look at it live, 99.9% of the time it never loads. Ever since the last update I can’t even use it. I can only play back video and even that takes a very very very long time to come up, IF it does. Sometimes I open the app and it’s just loading and spinning and can’t do anything. Force close and try again and it’s the same thing. 
When playing back video, if you want to skip ahead or rewind, the app thinks you are swiping back and it takes you back to the main screen. SO FRUSTRATING. This came from the last update. I used to think the canary was the best, now I see why everyone is getting rid of it.

title: It use to be good
text:
Canary use to record movement and make long videos once the sensors detected it. Basically if someone is robbing your home while you were gone it would record the entire 10-60 minute process

Fast forward to OCT 2018- now it just does a small “clip” of about 5 seconds of movement that you get notified from.  It doesn’t record squat unless you pay money for their recording service.  Honestly now it’s just a joke unless you shell out money monthly.  This isn’t what I paid for.  If I don’t have my phone on me and I get an alert of motion activity at home while away, I only get that single clip of the burglar. 

Don’t get canary, get a traditional home monitor system, with a local hard drive that can back up via cloud source with free space.  It’s easy to do any many online videos can t you how to do it.  No monthly fees and it records on demand or 24/7.

title: Not worth the cost
text:
The hardware and app used to be pretty solid. Things like air quality, humidity, temperature, and the alarm were wonderful, but it seems like the company just isn’t really around anymore for delivering updates and fixes. Multiple “features” are now broken, and the communications for fixes just aren’t happening from the Canary team. If the company would put some effort into squashing bugs, fixing issues, and development of better hardware features, I’d be a champion of the company. 

I bit the bullet and decided the monthly cost was fair for the features included, but now that alerts AND live view no longer work with the app, I just cannot recommend this hardware, app, or company. 

Until live view and alerts are fixed, you’d be better off with Ring or Nest. Read the reviews posted here for the app, and you’ll see why it’s only 2 stars.

title: Disappointed
text: Customer support bad. You ask question then wade through "answers" that are not helpful. No way to talk to anyone. Takes 15-20 seconds to "view live" then about 10 seconds to see anything. When you can view live, the view is clear and really good. You can view the days activity at the end of the day. If only it was easier to get help without having to wait for answers.  UPDATE: Went from bad to worse.  Cannot delete 1st Canary as password not accepted though it is exactly as I wrote it down. Cannot view activity. Says it's off line no help.  Finally half the screen turned black & froze up. Can't do anything. Deleted app & it says it cannot be loaded. Still no answer to my email.  I'm taking this piece of junk back.

title: Simple Home Security
text: The Canary can be broken down into two phases. Phase 1: quick and easy set up. Phase 2: enjoy peace of mind. It was simple it was to set this system up. For me, Canary came at a good time I've been having some issues with the independent contractors my building hires for apartment maintenance – but now I’m able to keep an eye on everything during these expected visits, with the bonus of being prepared for the unexpected. The video feed has good clarity and a 3x zoom function; the sound quality is good; and the alerts sent to my phone are quick and timely. Has a simple/sleek design that blends right in at my studio. Self-sufficient home security!

title: Flaky so far.
text:
I've had Canary for 10 days and attributed the systems buggy operation to my slow learning prowess. But, no more!  It wouldn't automatically switch from home to away, as advertised. Sometimes it insisted I was away when I was home. Today it wouldn't connect to my WIFI at all!  I called customer service and was impressed by a quick answer by a nice lady who asked me to log out and re download the AP.  I did, and for the moment, it seems to be working!  I will wait and see if it clanks again, and update this review accordingly.
Update:
The device seems to be working as advertised since my initial review.  Initial problems were caused by problems with my WIFI setup.  So far, so good!

title: Nice device
text:
I have been using this device for several months and there is allot of positives. The picture quality is excellent day and night, the environment controls are very accurate, and the proximity arm, disarm work very well.  

I would rate this app and device 5 stars, but there are serious issues with the app and widget when used for security monitoring. 

The widget has never worked, has always said log in to app, logged in, nothing, please fix. 

The notification on iPhone is almost useless to me. I have to check the app every time I look at my phone to see if I have any new activity. I have set all the notifications, best I get is a small sound when the ringer is on. I think it would be much more useful if it would sound or vibrate with a unique sound or pattern for at least 30-60 seconds, or acknowledged. If this is not possible on iPhone, then an option of sending notifications to an email or text.

I really like this product and the improvements, the only reason for 3 stars is the lack notifications when they happen. If this is fixed, and I know when activity occurs, I will give  5 stars.

title: Does need work
text:
I agree with other reviews that this needs some work. The design pattern where everything slides in from the top or bottom of the screen does not work as a primary navigation method.

There are some customization options that would be simple to add and would go a long way towards protecting user's privacy. 

The user should be able to disable audio recording at all times, not just in privacy mode. The user should be able to tell the Canary to switch to privacy mode automatically (nothing is recorded) when the user is home instead of only "disabled". And switching the Canary to privacy mode should not generate an action that appears in the timeline view (the one that says something like "Soandso activated privacy mode").

title: App Doesn’t function properly.
text: This app does not work with Apple Watch. It continues to ask me to open the Canary app and confirm I’m logged in. But there is not such request. SMH. Then I text support for help on that and another issue with the app, and she literally tries to sell me a promo membership extension as a “ compensation” for the inconvenience. When I expressed to her I knew about the promo, she tried to add 3 free months to the promo. I don’t want it and after that I’ll be switching to Arlo or Ring as soon as this membership is over. Their customer service representatives, every time I’ve been in contact with them, have been coy, dis attached, and frankly rude. Not good for anyone or anything that has anything to do with my safety and security. Very disappointed I trusted Canary, and even more dissatisfied at their service standards, or lack there of.

title: Don’t waist your money.
text:
The inside camera works fine and does a okay job. Picture quality is descent and picks up motion well. 
Response time is slow, about 20 seconds to get notified. This is on all my cameras. 
Not the wireless flex is 100 percent #%^+. It can’t stay connected to the internet. Customer support is horrible unless you have just bought it and setting it up for the first time. If you are unable to do it yourself and think you’re tech savvy. Wireless internet extender is a must to boost your internet signal for outside where the camera is and it has to be close to it as it can be. 
When the outside camera or Flex wireless camera is working, it does a decent job even at night. The motion range is about twenty feet away before it picks up the motion of the object and starts recording.
Hope this review helps.

title: Absolutely no phone support available.  Be forewarned!
text:
Canary has decided to discontinue all phone support. 

I just had to work through resolving an issue and I was left with two options...carry on a chat through the in app “get support” or to text/sms. I used the in app get support—as soon as I finished describing the issue I had a question about, the support rep wanted me to check if had the app configured a certain way. I asked him how I get back to this chat to continue with diagnosis of my issue. His only solution was to provide me with a case number and make my way back to the get support option, provide my case number, and start all over again with a new agent to work my issue. 

You’re selling a HOME SECURITY product — you’re priority should be assistance to your customers—NOT optimizing how many support sessions a single employee can handle at one time.

title: Struggles in Cold Weather + Poor Support
text:
I’ll start by saying that I really wanted these to work and work well. The camera quality is great, and Canary has a lot going for it in terms of feature and functionality. 

A few fatal issues hold Canary back.

- Support. It’s bad. Days to reply. Short and terse replies that don’t address the issue. Canned replies that obviously have been tried that don’t address anything the customer is saying. No desire to hear feedback or address complaints. All I ask for is “thank you, sorry, we’re working on it, and here’s an ETA. Let us keep you posted.” This, with a paid annual plan on top of 3 cameras.

- In cold weather the camera gets finicky. In colder weather, it works sporadically, if at all. As advertised, it should work in as low as negative 4. Nope. Starts having problems around 20 deg F.

- No masks. Unlike their older model, which I’ve had for 4 years, the new flagship doesn’t let you monitor only a specific area of the frame. If you live in an urban environment, you will receive false notifications and near constant recording.

- Bad Business. Pulling the plug on legacy free users who bought their product advertising full recording capabilities completely free for life. Amounts to bad business, if not false advertising.

title: Sorry I bought 3 canaries
text: When I bought my first Canary I loved it - 2 yrs later I bought 2 more.  To many reasons to list why I am sorry!!!  Top one right now is getting help seems to be about impossible.  I’ve spent a minimum of 5 hours in the last 2 days trying to get things fixed.  Can’t get help and don’t seem to be able to open a ticket. This is on top of having trouble with my 1st Canary that is at a different location.  Not sure how much time I’ve spent in the past year trying to get that going and finally gave up.  It suddenly started telling me something about an untrusted location, go to settings and allow untrusted connections....WHAT, REALLY??? What does that mean?When I bought the first one I checked into customer support first and thought it looked good.  Totally different opinion now!

title: Works as advertised
text:
Setup was easy. Seems pretty stable. I like the latest enhancements which include the notification widget and the auto privacy mode setting, but they are not loading to my iPhone although they readily uploaded to my iPad. 

I'm concerned that the armed notifications are not prominent enough and are easily missed if I'm not specifically looking at my iPhone and the time lag between detection and notification seems really long. Maybe the new notification widget addresses this?

title: Very well polished, but still a few bits to work out
text:
Overall, this app is as polished as my Dropcam app. 

PROS:
  - Intuitive interface had me up and running in a few minutes. 
  - Location-based auto disable works perfectly! (This one is iffy at best on my Dropcam Pro)
  - Camera quality is fantastic. The video is crystal clear and the wide angle lens captures the whole room. Night vision works amazingly well too!
  - The alarm is REALLY loud. 
  - Option to call local authorities / emergency services directly from app is a nice addition. 
  - Environmental monitoring works better than some of the standalone units I've tried in the past. 

CONS:
  - The night vision mode doesn't always turn off. This means black and white video during the day sometimes. 
  - New alerts aren't always available to view on the app until you are on wifi. 
  - Occasional "user unauthorized" errors are annoying. 

All in all, it's a good app and a very solid product. They could still do with some bug fixes, but I think these will replace my Dropcams!

The one thing that bothers me is the glowing light on the bottom of the device. When a burglar is in my house I want my security device to be as invisible as possible. A glowing light draws attention to it as an electronic device which is likely what they are trying to steal anyway. It would be more logical to have the light OFF when in Armed mode rather than broadcasting a green light to the intruder.  Stealth is your friend when it comes to video cameras. Don't tip off the location with lighting. 

Lastly, the live feed flickers off and on before finally staying on. Lag time was about 10 seconds or so. The quality of the picture is very good. 

Overall this is really a cool and simple device. Kill the visible light and speed up the feed and its a 5 star.

title: Always freezing
text: I love the idea of this and the camera gives a great quality picture, but the app is terrible. Several times a day it just loads for minutes. We use it as a baby monitor and as I type this, the picture has been “loading” for 20 minutes. If this were a one time occurrence it wouldn’t be a big deal, but this happens on a nearly daily basis. It also often freezes and there’s no way of knowing that the picture has frozen. For how much this device costs, it should work consistently. Every program/piece of equipment has a hiccup here and there but this is ridiculous and it needs to be fixed. Our internet is lightning fast, there’s no reason the canary should be behaving this badly.

title: Free features pared back considerably.
text:
Starting today, October 3, if you don’t pay for the membership you can only watch ~5 seconds of video when motion gets detected. I didn’t think it would be much of a problem because I understood that they would providing a “digest” of footage highlighting key events, but considering the camera misses the delivery guy walking right up onto my porch but sees my neighbor parking their car across the street, it’s not very useful. I end up watching 30 seconds of cars passing throughout the day and missing everything I bought these cameras for. 

I already spent $450 on the equipment, and seeing how they’ve continually pared back features, I don’t really feel incentivized to pay more money so they can lock more features behind a higher tiered subscription in the future.

title: Wishing for the old days!
text:
I have four (4) Canary cameras. When I purchased my first two camera the app was great. It had the occasional glitch, but it was otherwise a stable app. Since I have added my last two cameras things have changed. Canary has "updated" the app several times, however each time they update the app gets slower and more erratic.
Now, when launching the app it takes me a good 3-4 minutes to get a live feed from my cameras. I have re-installed the app several times to no avail. Also, I get a LOT of false alarms now due to shadows in my house. I have one cameras notifications settings turned to the lowest setting and I still receive false alarms. 
Canary....please fix this!!

title: Great device, app needs work
text:
Love the Canary device and concept. The video quality is excellent in both daytime and nighttime modes. And the air quality and temperature monitoring is a nice bonus.

But the app leaves much to be desired. The biggest problem is that it frequently shows the incorrect state or doesn't update to the latest event in the timeline. I'm constantly quitting and restarting the app to see timeline updates. Location support is also pretty bad. I was home all night but the app continued to show me as not home (thus leaving the camera armed). Again, quitting and restarting the app was the only way to fix it.

If Canary fixes the bugs in the app then this could truly be a 5-star system.

title: Dissatisfied  and Disappointed
text: I have paid for  the premium service for over a year now. I have become more and more disappointed by the apps capabilities and the device's. I used to be able to scroll down my timeline and view previous videos, now when I try I get a glitchy screen that jumps but does not scroll. The buttons below the question" How is your Canary experience so far?" does not work.  The Canary goes on and offline multiple times. In the beginning with the Canary it was great, however, I can't justify spending the money for the premium when it doesn't work. The purose of the product is to provide a sense of security and inorder to do that there has to be a certain level of trust; I no longer have that.

text: Even on the rare occasion this app functions correctly, it's garbage. Just please update this app so it works so I can at least feel like I got my money's worth out of this camera before I purchase a whole new system

title: Used To Work Great, Now Worthless
text: I took mine back to the store and complained loudly and often and eventually got a full refund. My Canary worked beautifully until Canary Corporate completely blew it by taking away previously free features and making the product an expensive paper weight. The box says no subscription is required or necessary but the reality is, as soon as your store receipt window closes, Canary yanks the rug out from under you and takes away the functionality unless you pay for a subscription. So not cool, Canary! Personally I think the wireless Night Owl product is a much, much better investment. And the video stays on your own Night Owl hard drive in your house and not on Canary’s Cloud Services. My expectation is that Canary could go out of business soon because of this blunder.

title: Free features were removed.
text:
I really liked the previous version with the free features which came with it. It was worth 5star. I was able to see a video for 12 hrs in the timeline and could download it for my personal records, without having a membership, plus all the other features which are still available. This gave me the best possibility to use the videos if I would need to fall back on it for evidence reasons. Even after they were removed from the timeline. 

But now with the latest update, the philosophy at Canary changed and this feature was removed. Basically I payed $200 (back then), for a home security system and I can’t even download a single video without having a membership?! After 24hrs the evidence is gone from the timeline. Well done!

title: Disappointed

title: Recent update ruined notifications
text:
Previously the app worked perfectly. Now since the update in August, the notification do not work and seems information and alerts most of the time don’t even push until the app is opened. This app needing to be opened to function issue also impacts the ability to change modes when someone leaves and arrives at home. Leaves and arrives notifications would sometimes even hit three time in a row when the app was finally opened. We even experience sudden ‘leaves’ from home while home now for no reason. 

This app needs to be reverted to the old version or updated ASAP otherwise I feel like the Canary will just become a neglected device with no support and a waste of money for all who have purchased it.

title: Very disappointed.
text: After following the development of Canary for the past 2 years I had such high hopes and waited in anticipation for my unit. I was at first impressed with the sleek packaging and product design, clearly inspired by one of industry's largest communication developers. Alas the joy quickly faded as I worked through the clunky setup and annoying lack of intuitive programming. So now a few weeks have gone by and the unit continually drops off line and interferes with my router performance.  Forget about viewing from across the net!  If it even connects you are lucky and the frame rate is horrible and I have top tier Verizon Fios, 4gLTE phone and wifi connection at work! What a disappointment. I certainly hope the development team some significant updates or this will be just another passing FAD.

title: Could be better
text: I have two canaries for three years now. One does not hold the Internet well at all. And it’s very frustrating. I have to constantly set it to Forget this device and reset it from there. Neither one of them are more than 25 feet away from my Wi-Fi, so that is not the issue. I don’t know why this one was such a lemon from the start I have written customer service many many times over the years over this one. They’ve always been helpful on getting me back on track. But I do wish they would just send me out a new one because this one is a lemon!

title: Really cool, super easy
text: The camera's way better than I expected, seems like HD. It's really cool to be able to check in on my apartment anytime I'm out or away on vacation for a while. I like the idea of being able to  set off the alarm remotely, would be cool to be able to actually communicate over it too with roommates or cat.

title: Worthless
text: Like the other reviews I too have had many problems with Canary. In the beginning I had 3 cameras....1 outdoor, 2 indoor. When they work they are great but their performance is not consistent. In less than a year the outdoor camera was always offline and would not hold a charge. After much frustration, I ended up throwing that one away. Now, just a couple months later, one of the indoor cameras is having the same issues. Chucked that one this morning so now we are down to one camera. I’m sure it’s only a matter of time before that one starts having issues too. Do not waste your money. Look else where for something more reliable.

title: Do Not Purchase Camera
text: As an early adopter of this camera, I am disappointed on where this service has gone. Canary now charges $10 per device per month to record video at night. I have 5 cameras and now I am better off with a more reliable home security service. Every few months, they take away free features and add more features to the paid subscription. I wouldn’t be surprised if by the end of the year, you won’t be able to view the camera without paying a monthly fee. This used to be an awesome product before they sneakily took features away and put them in for paid subscribers only. I understand companies need to make money, but for $200 a camera, you could give us the basics of recording during night time hours like before.

title: Skip canary and go for traditional monthly service

title: Customer service non existent
text: I’ve had my three units for a couple of years, and when they work, the images are good. When you have a problem and have read all the Q&A’s to no avail, you can’t get help. title: Update killed app
text: I want this app to work. I had the previous version for only a few days before the company updated their app.  The old app seemed to work fine but the updated version is just buggy. It definitely feels like a beta version.  The app crashed when I try to set my emergency numbers. The app freezes and is stuck saving tags when I try to tag videos. Finally my false alert rate seems to have gone up significantly. I want to like canary but a product is only as good as the software behind it and this software is terrible.

title: My New Obsession
text: I've had my Canary for about two weeks and it's all I can talk about. I'm not one to really try the newest gadgets or hype products, but I moved to a brand new apartment with all new furniture, etc and needed something extra. It's just a really cool product that's incredibly useful. Superior monitoring controls and a fantastic camera, the live feed is unreal and I think it necessary for everyone's main living space. After showing my parents- who have trouble finding the 'Settings' on their iPhones- they bought a Canary today.

title: Still have the original + 5 more love them

text: I have invested almost $800 in this service and 3 cameras. It is completely unreliable. I am almost never able to watch live. Cameras always go offline(not due to my internet or power). title: Money milking app
text: I use to LOVE and RANTED so much about this product, I even took it back from the States to use it in Malaysia (thankfully its dual voltage). That’s when the developers decided they need to milk more money out of their customers and make them subscribe for their stupid subscription in order to fully utilize what was once free features (such as recording at home mode - yes I use it cause I have cleaners or pet sitters that comes over when I’m home that I want recorded in case my things go missing). I even thought of buying one for my in laws but because of this new subscription service thing, I’m thinking of switching to another device instead (yes I rather pay a whole $200 for a new device than $10 a month service for current device).

title: Don't be scammed by false advertisement!
text: As a single mom I struggled over spending the money on this camera, but for my sense of security I did it.  It was supposed to record videos of activity in my home and keep them for a day.  A day is all I needed.  I was able to use this product for the sole purpose I purchased it for for less than a year before the canary company chose to change it.  Now it only records little bits, mere seconds .... not enough to know what happened or who was even in your house!  Now it tells me to see the whole video I have to buy a membership!  Total scam!  I can't afford a membership.... and I don't feel I should have to buy one when the product advertised something different!  This product is worthless now!

title: Bait and switch on features! Stay away!
text: I read a ton of reviews for home security cameras to act as a baby monitor and then a security camera after my son gets older and decided on the Canary Flex. A great piece of hardware that was competitive with the other competitors. Not any more! The features that were free are now paid! I get that they need to make a buck, but grandfather in your existing customers who bought your product expecting night mode and some amount of recording to be free! And two way talk way supposed to be another update that was free! Stay away and consider Arlo, Nest, etc who offer these feature for free! text:
I don't understand stand the 6 to 10 second video lag. This is unacceptable for any kind of security camera. There is no good reason for this, and I'm sure its the number one reason why canary hasn't kept there promise of enabling the 2-way audio on the flex. I'm new to canary but I can't believe this is not the biggest complaint of these cams. The app is great, one of the best on the market.
