title: Service is terrible
text:
App is average at best. But the $99 service is far from worth it. Delayed notification on movement, finicky setup, and absolutely the worst customer care I’ve ever experienced. 

Signed up for $99 monitoring charge. A week before I got an email reminding me and that I could cancel on the website. Website doesn’t work reliably from iOS, couldn’t even login. When logged in, receive regular errors in safari. 

They rebilled me, I emailed to complain. Informed they could cancel membership going forward but not refund. I explained that I tried to cancel - and then despite what their emails had said and what their customer rep had literally written two lines before - You cannot cancel on the website. You have to contact them. 

Looks like a scam. Smells like a scam. Cannot recommend their products or services. Will get a HomeKit enabled camera in the future. Disassembled my two canary cameras for parts and donated to local school science lab.

title: Degrading quality to the point of unusable.
text: I just updated the app today because the release notes said the iOS 13 crash (you know, the one that crashed the app literally every time I used it) was fixed. It failed to mention that it completely broke the ability to view live. I don’t know why I’m surprised—the quality of the service Canary provides has been decreasing so steadily since I was an Indiegogo backer in 2013 that I guess I should be surprised the cameras still even turn on. Do not buy these cameras; do not waste your time or your money. I wouldn’t even still be here if I didn’t already spend money buying several of these.

title: 1 Step Forward, 10 Steps Back!!!
text:
You guys at Canary need to get a clue on your product and your app you can never get anything right you remove Geo fencing and now it's all based off location boy runs all the time to me that's a no-brainer kill my battery some more what a waste

Update: as of October 3rd you now have to have a subscription to use it

Update: as of June 1, 2018 app is a little better but for the notifications is terrible worse. I pay the monthly fee and now because of 3 years later no support and only way to get it is through calling and even that is a joke. I will be canceling payed subscription as of today good bye joke of a security system..

title: Boo.
text:
They hook you in with features that can actually be useful for monitoring your home not just while you're away, but also while you are at home if you want to check and see what's going on in another room. Or at your front door.

They took away features that they said would be included without a membership, and now you have to pay for a membership to get them. I'm sure they have somewhere in their terms that state they can do this, but it still feels like a bait and switch to me. 

These devices were not cheap, and now I feel like we paid for three useless pieces of junk. I wish we had spent our money on a regular camera system that was not linked up to a service.

I think they should've at least grandfathered in the people who currently own canaries and let them keep the features they already have and apply the new features for new purchasers going forward.

Shame on you, canary!

I will not recommend this product to anyone else ever again.

title: Doesn't live up to the hype
text:
Canary has been an incredible disappointment all around. While the hardware is elegant and capable, the service is consistently poor. As of today Canary has been down for days with no explanation or resolution in sight. Thus Canary has become an expensive paperweight on my shelf. 

Even when it is working the service is buggy and cuts in and out constantly. It fails to arm / disarm automatically correctly and recordings shut off for no reason. This could be overridden by the "live record" feature which (of course) the dev team promptly took away in a recent update. Thanks a lot. Nothing like reducing functionality to make your users love you!

Oh and now that I pay for monthly storage things seem to have gotten worse and more unreliable. 

These are not early stage issues. This product has had ample time for iteration and improvement. It's actually getting worse and less reliable with each update. 

In short, do not walk but run from this product.

title: No HomeKit, no deal.
text: I had a Two Canary cameras once upon a time. After reading Privacy terms I sent back. You can’t even use these with the Home app. And since I like my privacy, particularly when putting a camera in my home, I’d like it to be covered by the Apple ecosystem. And since HomeKit is now a software upgrade its stunning they won’t upgrade their devices. The Internet and the Wild West mentality of apps snatching up data, possibly sneaking a peek inside your house, yah, no trust. It’s ridiculous by this point, Canary hasn’t upgraded to be part of a safer ecosystem. One that might even work on the Apple TV, if I’d like to see who is outside.

title: Always slow to load
text: The app is consistently slow to load, regardless of whether I’m connected to WiFi or not. I’ll often find myself going to open a notification, only to wait several minutes and then just receive an error (“unable to connect”) message. None of the other apps on my phone have such a delayed load time nor do they return an error as frequently. I’ve been told this is potentially an issue with my router or internet, but the Canary app seems to be the only one struggling. Hopefully I never have an actual emergency at home and need to see what is happening in a timely manner. Very disappointing.

title: Paid for live viewing?
text: I was so disappointed when Canary changed its business model after selling me services no longer available to me without the added expense of a membership. Now, I don’t have an issue with a business wanting to improve its cash flow, but by not grandfathering in its customers who were sold a different bill of goods; well, that’s just wrong IMO. I’m stuck with a security camera that no longer functions as advertised unless I shell out additional cash. I get that memberships or fees may be the norm for other companies, but that’s not a very compelling reason to stay loyal to Canary.

title: Don't waste your money
text:
I purchased one of these over a year ago, loved the service, and having the free 24 hour service was perfect so I purchased 2 more... the service now only records a snippet of movement - meaning, the moment there is movement it records about 2-3 seconds - what am I supposed to do with 2-3 seconds!?! 
 Now to make things worse, Canary decides out of the blue to change the rules - I believe once you advertise a product and it's features you should stick to it. I purchased this product because it was free - and compared to their competitors the price was right for what they were offering - Shame on you Canary - I am considering returning ALL of my products -

title: You cannot rely on this device for security.
text: If you are thinking about getting a Canary I urge you to wait for the software to mature before you do. The hardware is nice but as it currently stands you cannot rely on this device for security. It will go "offline" for hours at a time randomly. It will sometimes not record or notify you of activity and when it does it is often several minutes after the fact. There is a very annoying delay when viewing events or live video. I have to restart both the app and the canary itself regularly to get it to function as it should and even then I do not feel secure that it is working.

title: Don’t waste your money - BUYER BEWARE
text:
I have emailed the company several times due to my canary was not working. It will not show the video feed after a few months. I have tried all the tips on the website... didn’t work! 

After no response. I emailed asking that they discontinue my subscription—- no response!
When it was time to renew after over a year of paying and requesting they stop debiting my account.!another email was sent demanding them not to debit anymore payments. Finally someone emailed me back asking me for my new debit info due to the one expired . I informed them I would not be renewing. They renewed for a YEAR! After being told several times it’s not worked in a year and they have not assisted me and failed to respond to any correspondence.   
I’m seriously considering obtaining an attorney due to they have been instructed several times to freeze my account. 
Very very poor customer service to say the least 
BUYER BEWARE!!!!!!

title: Started off promising...
text:
I purchased my Canary maybe 4, 5 years ago. At first I loved it, but it quickly became an issue flagging reflections and other things as movement and a substantial amount of that movement as people. In fact, I completely ignore notifications now. There are so many solutions for better image processing and object recognition I cannot understand why their product is so bad.

It also consistently messes up geo fencing and flaps between away and home modes erroneously.

This all coupled with the push to limit features and require subscriptions has led me to the point where I’m just throwing mine away. 

All the actions of the company (aforementioned and difficulty/hardball tactics in returns and refunds of services) in the last 4-5 years has additionally led me to be weary of their privacy and security practices. Do I want to give them my location data anymore? No.

You started off well, but ended in trash, literally in the trash, sorry.

title: Don’t waste your money
text: I have had issues with the camera since I purchased it in April. The recording has been glitchy and does not record seamlessly. It has long pauses in the middle of recording and when it starts again, it is several seconds to a minute or two ahead. Since I am using it to monitor a dementia client for falls and issues, those seconds count. Will be going with another service. Also, if you have their premium service and cancel before the end of your subscription, you will not get a refund. They just cancel at your renewal date. Which is crap since their “service” is the reason I’m changing. Good riddance.

title: Terrible support
text: I find it hard to believe but if you have a question or an issue with your Canary there is NEVER a person to speak with.  All communication with them must be by either email or text.   I spent over an hour texting and my issue was still not resolved.  I feel this all could have been done with s 5 minute phone call and probably have had my questions answered.  I tried texting another time and it was approximately another 45 minutes. Keep in mind, they also cannot receive a photo or screen shot to represent your problem

title: Homesick Helper
text: We went on vacation one summer and I got homesick. I’m really attached to our pets, yeah I know weird. My Dad had this app and checked in with our cats, who were the only pets home, and it made me feel better being able to check in on them. I like the voice feature because I’ve seen many examples of it working, and our cats would even come up to it. I just don’t really like the tweet it makes when you press the voice button.

title: It could be better
text: Despite some negative reviews, I purchased the Canary to try it with Wink setup I have. Found out, it is true the delay is too much for a security system. Your internet connection better be fast. I have 30MB/s and still not enough.... Triggering is in need of some work, sun and cloud alternating from a close by window falsely alarmed repeatedly (about 2-4 minutes late though). Do not believe the Apple Watch compatibility, per Canary support "it is a mistake and does not work". They need to work on the cam and the application big time. Mine is going back. Will invest $ 200 in some real security device.

title: Good when it works
text: The cameras are great when they work but I often have issues connecting even though signal strength is fine. The app itself is also slow to load, if it loads at all. Lately it’s been logging me out and won’t allow me to log back in. Even customer support cannot figure out how to get me back in since the app is freezing. I’ve tried removing and reinstalling the app as well as restarting the phone. Also can’t view anything on the website. I now have no access to my own cameras. The fact that support can’t help is incredibly frustrating.

title: Very Disappointing!
text: I’ve had this Carary going on almost 3yrs.  It has done nothing but GONE DOWN HILL SINCE THE FIRST YR!!!!  People DONT WAIST YOUR MONEY!!!! The Quality isn’t what it used to be.. the Videos are all wiggly. Most only a few sec at a time. Then it will be any where from several min to 30-40 mins later before another video starts again. In the mean while I have MISSED IMPORTANT VIDEO TAPING CONCERNING OUR SPECIAL NEEDS DAUGHTER UNDER CAREGIVER WATCH... it gotten to where I’m looking for a much better  reliable Camera.   Any suggestions?   Once was a great Camera.  But guess got to big for good Customer Service.  I rather speak with a Person. The Text!!!

title: Waste of money
text: I used to be able to set sleep mode to record movement between 11pm and 5am, the recorded videos when movement occurred were longer, and had other features that I used for free and now I must pay.  So we paid for the camera because it had all of these nice perks and then the perks were taken away unless you wanted to purchase a membership.  It’s worthless at this point.  Any time my dog moves, the trees outside blow in the wind, light night strikes the camera alert goes off.  So I don’t look at the alerts because they are meaningless.  Sometimes the canary randomly loses connection.  If you really need security, this isn’t for you.

title: Trash
text: The camera functionality and ease of use, of the app was superb. A month in, it went “offline” supposedly due to engineers fixing an issue, but won’t come back on. It goes on and offline all day. That’s not security. You are also also forced to pay $9.99 for a membership to start the camera. I thought that was fishy but needed the device. I have since been refunded and I have a $200 camera that no longer works and “support” that doesn’t get back to you for days. When they do they keep blaming your internet speeds, or connection etc. But they won’t say it’s their devices. All the while the home is unattended.  Goodbye canary.

title: Used to work great, now terribly flawed junk
text: I've had my Canary for over a year. It was good at first - provided notifications, knew when you were home or out. But with all the latest updates and changes it simply doesn't work at all anymore. It never knows when I'm home (constantly turning itself on when it should be private), which I suppose is better than the opposite but still ... it does not function as promised. I'm starting to think the device has been hacked or I'm being spied on ... its creepy. How can you break something that used to work well? I wonder if they'll take the unit back now that they've thoroughly ruined it.

title: Can't hear notification sound 😭
text: Love this home security system, however it is a major major major flaw that you cannot change the sound the notification makes that your phone receives when the system has picked up movement. Right now it is automatically set to a simple and quiet "ding", which is very problematic for when you are sleeping and can't hear the notification.... You should be able to edit the notification for people who need to be woken when there is movement.

title: Constant false alerts, tracking drains battery
text:
So far, Canary, had been a severe let down.  This app tracks my location non-stop severely draining my battery. If I turn off location tracking, then it won't recognize that I'm home, or when I get home, for some reason. I am constantly getting false alerts for things that are not there like shadows, but when actual people are in my house…nothing?

It was supposed to be a smart camera, it is everything but smart though. Finally, when initially purchased, this was supposed to be a no subscription deal, even advertised as such. What is it now, subscription on top of hefty price tag.

title: Trying to charge me for a device I already had in my Premium Membership
text: My Flex camera wasn’t working. I went through troubleshooting documents and removed the device, but upon adding it again it’s asking to charge me $29 to add this device. I declined, because it should be included in my annual $99 for premium service, but I still got an email saying they charged me for it, and I still can’t get this Flex camera back online yet. I emailed support, and called in, but apparently their call volume is too high to get through. About to get rid of all these and switch to something else.

title: I phone issue
text: There is an issue with the Canary View. They had a firmware update and the camera stopped working. After almost 3 weeks of their prehistoric communication they sent me a new camera. Same issue. Went on you tube and found out I’m not the only one. I followed all the steps on there too, including a hard reset of my entire phone. Still nothing!! Can’t get a hold of anyone. No phone number to contact or customer service. I Phones will not hook up to this divide via Bluetooth. Because of this you can’t set the camera up!! Total garbage!!! Do not buy this camera!!!!!!

title: Subscription based security
text: While the camera itself works well, this company has been slowly removing features that were originally free and only releasing them back to you at the cost of a subscription fee. While I understand that they have costs associated with recording and storing video, its not like they are holding onto that video for very long even with a subscription, also upset that instead of allowing access to new features, any improvements of the sort will only go to those who have paid them.  Not mad, just very disappointed...

title: Apple Watch
text: I actually love my Canaries and thus the 2 star review. However, I have an Apple Watch and according to their site, I should be able to toggle between modes but I can’t. You can’t call anyone for help. You have to chat or text. Both are worthless. No one can answer anything but give me links to info I already know. Then they either “disappear “ for long periods of time or disconnect and you have to start all over. If support were better, I would give them 4 stars. Am hoping I finally get an answer to my question here. Why can’t I toggle between modes on my Apple Watch series 5???

title: Cameras are great, software is buggy
text: If you don’t mind the camera spontaneously recording you while your at home this is what you want. If your like me and would prefer the cameras work properly and only record while your gone... well this isn’t for you. The software is ridiculously buggy. Notifications are sometimes sent hours after the activity took place. The geofencing randomly works properly. Paying for a subscription won’t solve the issues. Very unnerving having the camera click on randomly and start recording. Please fix your bugs, I have major concerns with this product and my privacy.

title: Not worth buying or having anymore.
text: I’ve had the canary for years, back when you actually it was worth having. Today, it is a worthless camera that hardly works and you must purchase a subscription to make it even worth having. Not only do videos only save for 24 hrs, now you can’t even watch an entire video of what happened while not at home. Since the last update, the geofencing doesn’t work properly and the camera continuously goes offline. I’m seriously considering selling this and buying a Nest or other brand camera to replace Canary. I wouldn’t recommend the app, camera, or service.

title: Can’t track two people at once
text: I have had a Canary for a number of years.  Now that there is someone else in the house I set them up as an addition user so it would stop notifying me every time they move. I also got another Canary for the hall. It has gone haywire!!!! I get 10 notifications telling me he is at home and that he has left. Most of the notifications are a minute apart a few are at the same time. How can you leave and be home at the same time. Even with both of us home it doesn’t go into home mode until 3 hours later? So I get all sorts of alarms just moving around my house until it decides someone’s home.

title: Not Worth It
text: I've had Canary for a few years now and I've waited for a long time for some pretty simple functions that still haven't been rolled out. There is no API to homehealth information and thus there is nothing you can do with it. The person detection constantly sends notifications for non-persons: pets, lights, etc. The app is pretty limited and you doesn't take advantage of any phone storage. You need a membership with Canary to access and review videos more than a day old. I believed in Canary and was excited to have it to help protect my home, but it has ended up being a waste.

title: Don't purchase this product.
text: I bought my canary last year because they offered a customized night mode, 24 hour motion detected free away recording that recorded the entire time motion was detected. The new firmware update has made this product useless and I feel like I was tricked by bait and switch. You get 10 seconds of recorded viewing if someone breaks In your home, you get 10 seconds to see them! I can no longer set up night mode recording. I didn't buy a canary to get a preview of someone in my house. I guess the goal is forcing you to pay 9.99/mod or features they previously offered for free. Contract broken. I should get my money back.

title: Great system. So simple to install.
text:
I had bought an Amcrest camera but the instructions were terrible. The unit itself was probably okay but it was hell trying to set it up. 
I returned it and bought a Canary. Boom it worked right out of the box. Simple to set up. Just follow the few on screen instructions and you're good to go. Highly recommend this unit. Might cost a little more but you get what you pay for.

title: I’ve been with Canary for 5 years...
text:
And the quality has continued to worsen, the cameras ALWAYS miss important events with their stupid “record when (we want to)” motion feature is enabled, and the app continually spins and loads with frequent issues - Regardless of WiFi or cellular.

It’s a joke!

I own 5 canary devices and I’ve wished and hoped there would be improvements and overhaul over the years, but that has never happened. They’re now pushing professional monitoring and I’m awestruck that they’d offer such a service with their incredibly less than perfect platform. 

I’m about ready to ditch this system and am sorely disappointed - I often wonder why I even pay the monthly membership fee for such terrible quality! I’m writing these now while the app reports all of my devices are offline, while I can see them all glowing and our internet is working fine for every other smart device in my home.

title: Laughably Bad.
text:
Was given one of these as promotional item. Quickly realized why it was free. After a couple futile attempts to set it up, I uninstalled the app, unplugged the device, and put it on the kitchen table.

So I redownloaded the app today. As soon as I logged in, I got a "connected and updating" message. Huh? No chance. The thing is (still) unplugged– it's been a paperweight since Saturday.

And in case you run into the same problem, here's my favorite part, per the company website: "there is no way to factory reset your Canary View." Great work, team!

Other lowlights: The WiFi strength is just sad. Some of my kids' toys have better and more reliable connections. You can't sign up for any premium services within the app. Presumably this is because of bad engineering– or they're trying to keep from having to pay Apple for in-app purchases? Who knows. But honestly, as poorly as the whole thing is executed, I'm not sure I'd trust these folks with my financial data.

title: Extortion
text:
You've no doubt read the numerous complaints about the withdrawal of features unless you subscribe to a (quite expensive) "maintenance plan." No doubt the company is leaking dough by the bucketful, and somehow is trying to stem the hemorrhaging by forcefeeding its customers. 

However, in addition to that, switching cameras used to bring up video within a couple seconds. That's now been extended to a couple MINUTES.

I'm not sure if this is purposeful crippleware, further attempting to extort dollars to return features once included, but even if it weren't, it's a rather cheesy & unacceptable downgrade in performance.

title: Peace at mind
text: Love this service, granted I have horrible internet in my area, I still like the experience so far. It’s helped me communicate with my kids after school and helps watch my place while outta town. Simply put it’s definitely worth it. I’ll soon have better internet in my community and so I can’t wait so that I can add another 2 cameras at home.

title: Good camera incompetent software
text:
The camera is fine but Canary app is by far the least user friendly app I have ever seen. There is no way to delete unwanted scenes. It took over 2 hours to finally get the camera set up when I moved - it kept getting locked on an unwanted screen and couldn’t go back.  I had to completely delete the app and re-install it several times before I got one installation that actually worked.  The help menu is worse than a joke it’s incompetent!  I seriously considered putting a bullet through it and sending it back to the Canary CEO.
Doug Mitchell

title: Decent product but needs more options
text: This is my 3rd week and 2nd canary.  The first one was defective and wouldn't record when not plugged in.  The replacement has been working so far.  Customer support very helpful.  It would be a great option to manually be able to record if you see something while watching live!!!  Also the ability to rotate  the recording as my canary is upside down and obviously records that way!

title: So far so good
text: Successfully alerts when people come in. Great peace of mind. Has been successfully arming and disarming when my wife comes home. Alerts us when the dog moves around but so does Dropcam. Love the siren feature. Super loud and I feel like I have a nuclear launch button at my fingertips. Wifi/connection was much better after moving it to a better vantage point in our house and away from the kitchen.

title: Great app changing quickly
text: Really enjoying using the Canary. The timeline is a well designed feature and is surprisingly accurate, and I haven't had any trouble connecting to the live feed. My one complaint is that a lot of new features aren't well explained, so it can time and experimenting to figure out what functionality is available and how it works. Overall great product and companion app.

title: Needs some work but awesome app/product
text: I don't think these one star reviews are being completely fair given the products current capabilities and how far they've come. Yes it does need some improvements like actually having the siren kick off when motion is detected, or giving us the option to set an arm schedule based on time rather than draining our battery. If they fix that and lower some of their absurd costs for cloud storage (considering how minimal is actually consumed by those clips), I'd give them a 5!

title: Free membership no more
text: When I bought my canary for almost $200, I was able to view all movement that happened in front of the camera when I wasn't home for the last 7 days with no membership (membership would have extended the length of save time to 30 days). Canary changed its "free membership" so that now you can only view the first 10 seconds of the clip no matter how long the actually length of movement is that occurs. This is not sufficient to be a reliable security camera and it's unfortunate that canary didn't take care of its customers when it's sales pitch was that no contract or monthly fee was required.

title: Great potential
text:
This has the potential to be one of the best self service security options out there, but for some reason I'm not receiving alerts from Canary. I have to open the app and go to the timeline to view detected activities. 
I purchased Canary because our house was recently broken into and a lot of our stuff was stolen. The setup was very easy. If the notifications came through on a regular basis is rate this at 5 stars. 
Another feature I'd like to see is custom permissions for users with the app.

title: Canary camera
text: We have had our canary for at least four years and at first it was great.  Then the company wanted you to subscribe for a fee.  The reason we got it in the first place was that there was no contract and no fee.  We did not subscribe. At first things were fine, but now the camera is offline more than it is online.  We have done everything suggested to improve the connection, it is practically in a direct line to our WiFi router with nothing obstructing the signal. Why would I ever pay for a service that is offline almost all of the time?  We are looking at other options.

title: Won't stop monitoring when home
text: Mine has been continuously recording when I'm home. I turned watch live off when home, and record video when home, but I constantly get notifications when I walk around at home. The feature immediately turns itself back on when I turn it off. I have now powered the unit down and will test it once a week until this bug is fixed. I can't trust it as is, it's disturbing to walk around home and see the monitoring light on, on my unit knowing even when I turn it off on the app it turns back on.

title: I feel safe
text:
Thank you for enabling nightmode for all users!! I’ve been using canary for about 2
Years and it’s the BEST. When people are working on my house it reassures me, when my dogs ate my couch I used the siren to stop them, and nightmode watches my house while I sleep making me feel safer. I LOVE alerts when my house temperature falls below normal or air quality is a concern. Thank you thank you thank you! Can’t wait to add a flex!

title: Cannot tell the difference between a bug and a person
text:
No amount of tagging will stop it from alerting on insects or lightning . The alert for people setting is pointless if it alerts for every insect. The app asks for feedback but the yes button doesn’t work. 

The developers response I received contains a link that says run it off battery and it will work better. Seriously?? How about you fix it. That would be best. I have a competitors camera that works fine. Also how do you run the canary all in one off battery when it doesn’t have a battery?

title: Nothing but problems
text: I added my husband as a user and her never set up his profile, the away feature doesn’t work now. I’ve tried deleting his profile and I can’t, I’ve done every step listed in the website thru my phone, my laptop and even my desktop work computer. I tried contacting support and was sent the same directions as online, that don’t work. I’ve update the app, tried a different phone and still can’t delete his profile. The app is not easy to navigate at all. Would not recommend the app or the product!

title: Garbage ripoff
text: Actual 150 dollar piece of garbage. Does not detect motion or send alerts. This company is a total joke. If there wasn’t a bunch of fake positive reviews holding this app at 3 stars it would have an overall 1 star rating.  It is highly doubtful any updates that make a difference will ever be released. This camera honestly isn't even good enough to be considered a chew toy for your dog. Then they want a monthly subscription to access a bunch of services that DONT work??? Well... if they are good at one thing its scamming people’s money by selling them trash disguised as a “product”... it’s really too bad their skillset isn’t in making security cameras.

title: Got my money and then removed features
text: Can’t get my live feed to load. Deleted and reinstalled the app and it still isn’t working. Tried on both iPhone 7 Plus and 9.7 iPad Pro. If I hadn’t purchased so long ago, I would return it. This type of stuff shouldn’t be allowed. How is is it fair for a company to sell something and then change the way it functions so that you have to pay for those same functions if it isn’t a trial period? No way a live feed should be a pay only feature. I lost $200 and I have to look for another solution. I will not purchase another canary device ever again.

title: Totally recommended
text:
I absolutely love this system. It's very sleek, while not as small as a Nest cam, it makes up for it in a polished design and more features. The quality is great, and the prices reasonable. The app is simple, although it seems to have some growing pains. 
The only gripe I have is that I wish the status LEDs could be turned off. I like the lost connectivity warning but the others seem superfluous and kind of defeat the "stealthy" side of a security system.

title: Great device but buggy software
text: The canary device is great in theory and awesome when it works, but the software has many issues. It often fails to update my location and will stay in away mode and send me notifications despite me being home and on the same wifi network. A recent update seems to have broken the ability to manually override the mode, so if it's night time hours, canary will insist on setting itself to night mode despite my attempts to set it to home.

title: Love the product, the best so far compare to other products in the market
text:
Reason for giving 3 stars... 

- no option in the iOS app to turn off the status light below the device. 
- the time it takes for the video to upload, receive notification of an activity... Takes 3-4 mins for me. I have good upload speeds. I'm also using Ring door bell which uses WebRTC to transmit its video, notifications to my iOS and video uploads are instant. I wish Canary can adopt similar video technology in their product.

title: Sleek design, great experience
text: I'm a backer and have been using Canary for a few weeks. Love this new app update! Watch Live loads quickly and is more stable now. I really like the new features - especially that the device automatically goes into Privacy Mode when I'm home. The Geofencing has significantly improved. Overall, the product just keeps getting better and better!

title: Worked great at first...now not so much
text:
I was so pleased with Canary in the beginning that I purchased an additional one for outdoors. Both were fantastic until recently. I believe an update was done that has since caused problems. Despite all my troubleshooting efforts, I cannot resolve the following issues: •Both cameras are staying in Home mode the majority of the time. I cannot even manually switch to away or night mode. 
•Night mode will sometimes activate automatically at 1:00am when it should have activated at 10:00pm. 
•The indoor camera will randomly record in home mode. 
•The camera won’t connect to the server. 

I’m extremely disappointed because I had so much hope for these. I had even planned to buy 2 more to place in other locations outside my home. Don’t think I’ll be doing that now unless someone can fix these problems and fast.

title: Camera is now useless unless you pay for subscription
text: I purchased this before they changed their free service and it was a good camera for the most part with a few hiccups with connection dropping. Like others have stated it is now useless unless you pay for the subscription. DON’T buy these cameras!! I have the Arlo Pros surrounding my house and you get 7 days of free cloud recording on 5 cameras. I have two Waze cams indoors and they are amazing. NO monthly fees for anything and free cloud recording. You get two way talk which canary now makes you pay for. Canary is an untrustworthy company and will never get another dime from me.

title: Worked fine...now not very good.
text:
Was working OK but while in Europe noticed it was offline. Contracted Canary who said someone at home would have to reset it. Was able to get son in law to stop by and he was unable to get reconnected. He’s very tech oriented. 
Got home and have been messing with it for days. I don’t care about “masks” and non-functional “presence alerts”, I just want Canary to ID suspicious activity while I’m away. For two days it’d send me notices if wife was in camera range, not me, just her. 
Somewhere night mode was activated and set to 12:01 PM to 6:01 AM (16 hours!!)...not (intentionally) by me, but set up is so unuser friendly, who knows?
Have contracted Canary through cumbersome text/chat thingy that is sub par. 
All I want is for Canary to notify me when someone is in my house when my wife and I are gone. It used to do that just fine. 
Can’t imagine paying a subscription fee for this service.

title: A new low for the company
text:
Withdrawing the recording in home mode an also the night mode to force the customers buy your membership is wrong, are you really that low on income???

Update NOV 2: 👍🏼

I received the news mail from the CEO and I’m happy to see that they are bringing back the functions they previously removed from the basic plan, in my opinion the hardware and the app are ok but the delay in the notification time must be improved (it takes like 3-5 minutes to alert me).

title: Canary is a scam.
text: When you purchased the product- prior to August 2017, they offered free home and night mode monitoring then a membership was needed to do 30 day archives and for more features.  Nowhere in the documentation at purchase time did it say after 1 year of free home and night mode monitoring- that one would have to buy a subscription service to keep that monitoring going.  So I give Canary Zero out of 5 stars since this purchase has become a total waste of money. In fact now I view it as a possible privacy concern only.  I would recommend a different security service if you plan to pay for one.

title: Lots of connection and app crash issues lately
text:
I’ve had Canaries for 4 years. It is performing more poorly now then ever.  It was pretty reliable before, but not enough for me to replace my alarm panel monitoring with what Canary is offering.

If they can provide supervision on the connection that isn’t a Canary issue vs. real network issue, and fix app crashing concerns I might consider it.

I do like what the Canary offers with video and other telemetry information.  So keep working on improving it, and you may get my monitoring.

title: Useless device and support completely unhelpful...
text: I got my device several weeks ago as an initial kick starter supporter. I have never been able to get my device to connect to their servers and complete the set up process. Initial errors were server internal errors I contacted support and set up a help ticket. Several emails back-and-forth said basically for me to wait as updates and firmware updates were coming. Several weeks later I now get error saying my canary cannot connect to their servers and am still unable to use my device. Searching the help system online has also been futile.

title: Cant get PIN for 2-step auth
text:
Until recently, I was really pleased with the app and it’s functionality. But once I activated 2-step authentication, that’s when the problems started happening. When I try logging in from a personal device like a phone or tablet, I will get the prompt that a PIN was sent. But the problem is, I never receive it. Customer Service is slow to respond via the text method. Have not tried calling in. 

But like I said, I have been pleased with the app until recently.

title: Worse customer service
text: My friend gave me the camera, and since she gave it to me I could not connect it, instructions in the web page says that you have to disconnect the app from her phone, but she has no option to do so.  We have been trying to contact customer service for more than 15 days sending emails and they (automated reply) always respond to the same e-mail, asking for the serial number and saying that they will solve it in 1 to 3  days ... And it remains the same until now. Is unbelievable that there ISN’T HELP IF YOU HAVE ANY ISSUE WITH THE CAMERA !!!
